Company Profile:
RMA entered the Cambodian market in 1992 as an exclusive provider of dedicated system solutions for commercial and non-commercial enterprises in the sectors of infrastructure, energy and logistics. Gradually, the company has been growing alongside the development of Cambodia and expanded to automotive, agricultural and heavy equipment, warehouse solutions, financial services, car rental and food franchise management.  In addition to business expansion, RMA Cambodia has also focused its attention on human resources by providing internships and employment opportunities to approximately 2,000 local and professional staff with a number of expatriates working together to share their skills and expertise.

RMA Cambodia has also been very active within local communities. We consistently work with local authorities and organizations to provide financial and technical assistance in essential key sectors, such as health, environment, education and sports.

We aim to help Cambodia grow and prosper.

OUR SERVICES AND PRODUCTS:

RMA Cambodia and its affiliate Asia Vehicle Rental (AVR) are offering franchised car rental services through the global brand AVIS. Rentals are customized with brand-new Ford vehicles and experienced English-speaking chauffeurs. AVIS also offers car rental and leasing that meets all types of customers requirements for business trips, leisure or field work, with or without chauffeurs.

RMA Cambodia has a financing arm, RMA Financial Services, offers financing solutions to flexibly meet the needs of corporate and retail customers for the purchase of their own automotive and heavy equipment, agricultural machinery and warehouse solution equipment.

RMA Cambodia is also a provider of heavy equipment products and solutions in construction, road building and maintenance, and agriculture, namely JCB, Mitsubishi FUSO and John Deere. RMA Cambodia is an agent for the world’s leading brands in these industries.
Contact Info: Contact Information EFG Cambodia   017 888 349 efgcareer@rmagroup.net #320, Mao Tse Tong Blvd, Sangkat Tek Laak 1, Khan Toul Kok 017 888 349

Job Description:
Overall Purpose of the Role:
The School Director Position is equivalent to the Vice-President of the School in charge of the Academic Affairs. The Director also serves as the Vice-Chairperson of the School’s Academic Council, after the School President. S/He is in charge of the overall management of the school activities and services to the students and parents across the school campuses. The School Director is the key person to ensure that all aspects of internal and external compliances and best practices are in place, including curriculums, student learning and achievements, health and safety, service management as well as parent relations

The School Director represents the school in public.

a.	Academic Management

i.	Lead and collaborate with all program management teams in planning, execution, monitoring and evaluation of all academic programs, curriculums and student assessments.
ii.	Ensure proper coordination, alignment, consistency as well as smooth, effective and good practices of programs, curriculums, and disciplines and campuses.
iii.	Ensure that cross-cutting and mainstreamed programs are well blended and balanced for effective student learning.
iv.	Lead the review of the assessment and evaluation of student learning outcomes and continuing improvements.
v.	Coordinate with campuses to assess, review and evaluate the need, program availability and deliveries of the staff professional development, including the members of the management.

b.	Operational Management
i.	Lead the resource planning and evaluation processes for campuses and programs.
ii.	Manage and evaluate the campus and program management team members.
iii.	Manage and approve the expenses of the campuses and programs based on the delegated level of authorities.
iv.	Collaborate with the Operation Departments to actively contribute to the strategic review of the school operations.
v.	Ensure school compliances with accreditation bodies and standard organizations.

c.	Service Management
i.	Review and set a comprehensive service standard for the students, parents and communities for campuses to implement, adjust and improve.
ii.	Assess and evaluate the alignment and coordination of campus services operation.
iii.	Ensure that school-wide action plans are materialized and aligned across campuses.
iv.	Manage cross-campus requests/events/activities in consultation with all stake-holders.
v.	Represent the school in public events and relations as needed
Job Requirement:
•	Master’s degree in education/Educational Administration or Business Administration.
•	English as a first language or proof of professional English proficiency
•	At least 10-year experience in teaching.
•	Solid experience in school-wide administration.
•	Solid leadership experience, particularly in coaching/mentoring.
•	Solid Experience in Curriculum Management, Accreditation and business compliance.
•	Proof of reputable personal and professional integrity and records
Company Profile:
Footprints International School is an educational institution licensed with the Ministry of Education and registered under Eduinvest International Co. Ltd. The school currently operates in central Phnom Penh with one campus in Tuol Kork and another Tuol Tom Poung. Both campuses serve students from nursery to year twelve, covering the Cambridge International Curriculum and the Khmer National Program.

Accredited by the Western Association of Schools and Colleges (WASC), our community considers innovative approaches to teaching and learning the centric method to gear students’ towards our school wide learner outcomes. We support students in developing a growth mindset leading to lifelong habits in learning and a global mindset through which students adopt 21st century skills and sustainable living practices. Creativity is fostered through an integrative and experiential learning approach to Sciences, Technology, Engineering, the Arts and Mathematics (STEAM).

Our school highly values community engaged learning and experiences, with a special emphasis on Khmer Language and Culture. Through this program we aim to ensure that our learning is local, authentic and relevant. The holistic approach of these educational anchors is embedded in our vision, mission and values – and help guide the daily teaching and learning practices of Footprints.

Our core values are Responsibility, Compassion and Determination.
Contact Info: Contact Information HR Department   011 555 407 hr@footprintsschool.edu.kh St. 135, No 84, Tuol Tompung, Phnom Penh, Cambodia. 011 555 407

Job Description:
Overall Purpose of the Role: 

A Program Principal is the manager of the assigned academic program school-wide and serves as a member of the FIS Academic Council and Senior Management Team. The focus of the Program Principal role is supporting student learning and ensuring the quality of the program service deliveries in three main areas: curriculum, instruction and assessment in all campuses. 

At school level, the Principal works under the direct supervision of the School Director or School President or Vice President acting in the School Director capacity, to ensure program alignments and assist the Head of Campuses by supporting the program leaders across-campuses on program administration, program action plans, teacher management and campus strategic management of the program. 

As a manager, at program level, he/she is responsible for planning the program resources and personnel, putting in place standards for program management and monitoring as well as evaluating the efficiency and effectiveness of the program service deliveries in collaboration with the program management team, teaching cohorts, teaching assistants and their managers as well as all other stake-holders. 

In terms of curriculum, instruction and assessment, the Program Principal is responsible for ensuring the effective implementation of the Cambridge International Examination Curriculum, consisting of both the core curriculum and specialist curriculum, and other program criteria under the school-wide action plan and accreditation requirements. The Principal generally solicits feedback and inputs from all stake-holder and coordinates program-wide professional development activities based on need and available resources

Job Responsibilities:
The focus of the Program Principal role is supporting student learning and ensuring the quality of the program service deliveries in three main areas; curriculum, instruction and assessment in all campuses. 
•	Plan Program Resources and lead the WASC self-study process and subsequent reporting, school-wide action plan and producing other reports for the program and any assigned campus. 
•	Formulate learning related policies and monitor student assessment protocols and data for decision makings and progress.  
•	Administer program resources and conduct professional development activities for program personnel 
•	Communicate with all stakeholders on the program requirements and reports via emails, meetings, newsletter and all other selected platforms.   
•	Collaborate with the program management team, teaching cohorts and relevance departments to recruit, manage and monitor program staff performance throughout the program.  
•	Collaborate with the program management team and teaching cohorts to monitor the implementation of the assigned curriculums and program extracurricular activities to ensure students’ learning quality and progress.  
•	Oversee the implementation of health and safety protocols and the child safety policy across the assigned Program and when needed with an allocated campus.
Job Requirement:
•	Master Degree in Education/Educational Administration or Business Administration.  
•	English as a first language or proof of professional English proficiency
•	At least 5-year experience in teaching 
•	At least 3-year experience in school leadership positions. 
•	At least 3-year experience in coaching/mentoring teachers.  
•	Experience in Curriculum Management, Accreditation and business compliance is a plus. 
•	Proof of reputable personal and professional integrity and records

Job Description:
Overall Purpose of the Role:
The Deputy Head of Campus (DHC) role provides direct support to the Head of Campus (HoC) as a member of Campus Management Team in collaboration with the Program Management Teams and other Managers in the campus including the Family Engagement Manager and the Operation Manager. She/He co-manages all components of the campus, particularly in the areas of the assigned focus and level of authority, including Academic and Operation and services.

The DHC assists and reports directly to the HOC to ensure all aspects of internal and external compliances and good practices, including curriculums, student learning and achievements as well as health and safety.
The DHC represents the School Campus in public when assigned by the HoC

Job Responsibilities:
a.	Academic Management
i.	When assigned by the Head of Campus, collaborate with respective program management teams in planning, execution, monitoring and evaluation of all academic programs, curriculums, and student assessments in respective campuses.
ii.	Work with the Head of Campus to oversee the implementation of the academic program and disciplines and observe their coordination, alignment, and consistency against the students’ learning at campus level.
iii.	Work with the Head of Campus to observe at campus level and report to the Academic Council on program interventions for effective student learning.
iv.	When assigned by the Head of Campus, collaborate with respective program management teams to review the assessment and evaluation of student learning outcomes and continuing improvements. 
v.	Collaborate with all program management teams to assess, review, and evaluate the need, program availability and deliveries of the staff professional development, including the members of the management. 

b.	Operational Management 
i.	Contribute to the resource planning and evaluation processes for the campus. 
ii.	Per the assignment of the Head of Campus, evaluate the respective campus management team members and provide inputs to the evaluation of the academic team and staff. 
iii.	Manage and approve the expenses of the campus based on the delegated level of authorities. 
iv.	Collaborate with the Operation Departments to actively contribute to the strategic review of the campus operations. 
v.	Work with the Head of Campus to ensure campus compliances with accreditation bodies and standard organizations. 

c.	Service Management	
i.	 Help to ensure that the service standards for the students, parents and communities of the campus ate implemented as well as adjusted and improved when needed.
ii.	 Observe, assess, and evaluate the campus services operation for improvements. 
iii.	Implement and observe the school-wide action plans at the campus level based on the assignments. iv. Attend inquiries on cross-campus requests/events/activities in consultation with all stake-holders per assignments. 
iv.	Represent the school campus in public events and relations when assigned by the Head of Campus.
Job Requirement:
•	Master’s degree in education/Educational Administration or Business Administration. 
•	English as a first language or proof of professional English proficiency 
•	At least 5-year experience in teaching in international schools 
•	At least 3-year experience in school leadership positions. 
•	At least 3-year experience in coaching/mentoring teachers. 
•	Experience in Curriculum Management, Accreditation and business compliance is a plus. 
•	Proof of reputable personal and professional integrity and records.

job title: School Nurse - One Position at Toul Kork Campus
position: School Nurse - One Position at Toul Kork Campus
Job Description:
•	Provide health assessments, based on health and developmental history of students.
•	Plans and implements school health management protocols for students with chronic health problems, including the administration of medication.
•	Screens and evaluates findings for deficits in vision, hearing, growth, etc.
•	Initiates referrals to parents and school personnel for intervention, remediation, and follow-through
•	Provides updated information to students, parents, and school personnel.
•	Maintains, evaluates, and interprets cumulative health data to accommodate individual needs of students.
•	Develops procedures and provides for crises intervention for acute illness and injury.
•	Promotes and assists in the control of communicable diseases through early detection, surveillance, and reporting of contagious diseases.
Job Requirement:
•	Degree in Nursing or relevant fields
•	Basic computer and English skills
•	Experience working with young children is preferred.

job title: Personal Teaching Assistant - One Position at TK Campus (Early Childhood Program)
position: Personal Teaching Assistant - One Position at TK Campus (Early Childhood Program)
Job Description:
Job Description:
Personal Teaching Assistant is expected to report to the Learning Support Coordinators for updates on their child. They will be provided with training and workshops by the Learning Support Coordinators once a month and will be monitored every week for updates and will be evaluated every term for their performance. 

Job Responsibilities:
•	Reinforce and review concepts and skills as supervised by the teacher. 
•	Assist the student in performing activities initiated by the supervising teacher.
•	Monitor student progress in instructional programs and relaying findings to supervising teacher.
•	Help prepare instructional materials designed by the supervising teacher. 
•	Monitor and reinforce student performance concerning behavioral interventions through observation, data collection, compilation and record keeping.
•	Assist in maintaining records associated with the parent conferencing procedure.
•	Manage student during times when the teacher is involved in the regular performance of professional duties or has logical emergency reasons for being out of the classroom. 
•	Attend PTA training
•	Demonstrate knowledge of curriculum content for classes in which he/she assists. 
•	Assist with the physical needs of student, when needed– feeding, toileting, dressing
Job Requirement:
•	At least college level
•	At least 1 year of experience working with children from 3 to 10 years old in any capacity

Qualities:
•	Confident in communicating with parents and teachers in both Khmer and English.
•	Enjoys working with children.
•	Willingness to learn.
•	Adaptable to changes

job title: Teaching Assistant for Early Childhood Program (Two Positions) (Toul Kork Campus) & Teaching Assistant for Primary Program (One Position) (TTP Campus)
position: Teaching Assistant for Early Childhood Program (Two Positions) (Toul Kork Campus) & Teaching Assistant for Primary Program (One Position) (TTP Campus)
Job Description:
•	Work with the Head Teacher to instruct the set curriculum. 
Observe the teaching styles, methods, and language used by the Head Teacher in an effort to improve personal.
•	Support the Head Teacher by taking reading groups, assisting in lessons, behavioral management, classroom organization, and preparation of materials as discussed with the Head Teacher.
•	At all times treat students and teachers with respect and courtesy, behaving in a professional manner.
Provide care and ensure the safety and well-being of every child in the school.
•	Be responsible, in conjunction with Head Teachers, for ensuring adequate supervision of a safe recreation and play period for the students during class recess or break times.
•	Speak and behave in a professional manner towards all parents, students, and staff of Footprints School.
•	Work as part of the Footprints School team, communicating with the Head Teachers, with teacher assistants, and with the administration staffs, as necessary.
•	Support students and teachers with special needs when required.
•	Carry out specific assigned duties such as Sleep Room Duty, Lunch Duty, Gate Duty, lunch time supervision of students, Playground Duty as requested and scheduled during regular working hours by Administration.
Be available for and attend all Khmer staff meetings.
•	Be available for and attend any staff training sessions held on weekdays.
•	Be available for Parent-Teacher conferences at the end of each term which generally occur outside of working hours on a weekend.
•	Attend all school sponsored functions that occur during regular school hours, such as opening ceremony, graduation ceremony etc.
•	Attend public workshops and other events outside of regular school hours when given prior notice.
•	Be available to speak with parents before or after classes, or when called upon by the school management to do so Maintain facilities, resources, and materials in his/her classroom and the school.
•	Perform administrative tasks as required by the school. 
•	Perform other reasonable tasks requested by the school management
Job Requirement:
•	College-level Education (bachelor’s degree)
•	Experience working with children from 3 to 10 years old in any capacity.
•	Confident in communicating with parents and teachers in both Khmer and English. 
•	Open to learning and passionate to work in education and classroom.

Job Description:
• Ensures a clean and tidy working area without unnecessary losses of consumables/chemicals, in line with the defined and implemented safety standards and following 5S and HACCP/ISO22001 standards at the workplace.
• Makes all the quality checks in line with procedures on sampling and analyses.
• Participates and plays an active role in improvement teams related to the laboratory and supports the implementation of these improvement opportunities or corrective actions in the laboratory (ISO9001, TPM, etc.).
• Executes all simple laboratory analyses (Analytical and Microbiological), including sampling, sample preparation, and reporting results, in line with the valid Laboratory Methods.
• Prepares chemical solutions needed for the analyses (in the laboratory and production environment).
• Executes simple activities for the local Sensory Panel
• Performs simple maintenance, calibration, and verification of analysis equipment (in laboratory and production environment).
• Keeps track of the availability of laboratory materials.
Job Requirement:
• Education: Minimum secondary education level (chemistry). A general certificate of laboratory technician (physical-chemical and/or microbiological) is preferred.
• Experiences: Preferably laboratory experience (food industry).
• Skills: Preference for experience in English

Job Description:
• Responsible for developing concept, design, implementing PD information management and providing business intelligence in order to support PD stakeholder’s decision-making process and overall business strategy. 
• Coordinate between the partner and internal department to ensure transactions are complete, accurate and timely
• Ensure and timely generation and make available reports required by partners and internal teams
• Liaise with Sales teams to ensures all required logistics are in place
• Assist and monitor across channel strategic initiatives that will drives achievement, exploring business improvement across business channel
• Responsible for business quality assurance implementation and monitoring across PD channel in order to maintain its services standard and value add to all business partners
• Ensure SLAs agreed with partners are met
• Responsible for credit life business development and target achievement
• Responsible for monitoring sales & channel activation through strategic communication, thematic program and various campaign across distribution channel; in order to support improvement of sales productivity and achievement
• Responsible for maintaining and monitoring banc assurance sales operation to support smooth sales daily activity. 
• Developing and maintain good relationship with all PD stakeholder’s in order to support PD overall business strategy and development 
• Responsible for PD budget monitoring in order to support PD business development
Job Requirement:
• Education – Bachelor in Economy or Business Management
• Minimum 4 years in insurance industry, banking, or finance with exposure in business process and project management
• Sound knowledge of Microsoft office
• Strong leadership and communication skill
• Good communication and negotiation skill
• Able to work in fast paced environment
• Ability to lead team effectively
Company Profile: AIA Cambodia is guided by our Purpose to help Cambodians live Healthier, Longer, Better lives. Since commencing business in 2017, we’ve become the first life insurer to provide coverage on 26 critical illnesses. As among the Kingdom’s leading insurers, AIA Cambodia today offers market-leading life solutions for all walks of life ranging from tailor-made crucial coverage plans that include critical illnesses, accidents, hospital allowances and overseas emergency assistance.AIA Cambodia has strived to make a significant, positive impact for our customers and communities. As we look to the future, this commitment is reinforced by our Purpose: to help millions of people live Healthier, Longer, Better Lives. Our Purpose guides the decisions we make and the actions we take as an organization — empowering and enabling people to understand and manage their health, while meeting their long-term savings and protection needs. Helping create a healthier Asia is one of the most important and valuable things we can do for our communities, today and tomorrow.AIA Cambodia is the only Cambodian life insurer awarded HR Asia’s “Best Companies to Work for in Asia” for three consecutive years, in 2020, 2021 and 2022. Headquartered in Phnom Penh, the company currently has branches in Siem Reap, Kampot, Kampong Cham and Battambang.

Job Description: -ជ្រើសរើសបុគ្គលិកភ្នាក់ងារ រៀបចំវគ្គបណ្តុះបណ្តាលនិងបង្កើតវគ្គហាត់សមទៅអោយបុគ្គលិករបស់ម៉ាក់ស៊ីម៉ាដើម្បីធានាថាពួកគេបានយល់ច្បាស់ពីការងារមុនពេលអនុញ្ញាតឱ្យពួកគេចុះបំពេញការងារ ដោយការទទួលខុសត្រូវ។-ធ្វើការណាត់ជួបជាមួយភ្នាក់ងារដើម្បីចុះហត្ថលេខាលើកិច្ចព្រមព្រៀងការងារ-ចែករំលែកបទពិសោធចំណេះដឹងនិងមេរៀនដែលបានរៀនដល់ភ្នាក់ងារដើម្បីឱ្យពួកគេយល់ដឹងកាន់តែប្រសើរឡើងថែមទៀតដើម្បីកែលម្អដំណើរការការងារ។-រៀបចំឯកសារនិងកិច្ចសន្យាខ្ចីប្រាក់មុនពេលបណ្តុះបណ្តាលនិងធ្វើការ-ត្រូវរៀបចំកាលវិភាគនិងស្នើសុំសម្ភារៈប្រើប្រាស់សម្រាប់គម្រោង។-ពិនិត្យមើលរាល់ឯកសារឥណទាននិងឧបករណ៍ប្រើប្រាស់ទាំងអស់ស្ថិតក្នុងស្ថានភាពល្អនិងត្រូវបានថែរក្សាដោយភ្នាក់ងារ-ប្រមូលឯកសារឥណទាន និង កិច្ចសន្យាខ្ចីចងការពីតំបន់ប្រតិបត្តិការដើម្បីរក្សា ទុកនៅ ទីស្នាក់ការកណ្តាល-ផ្សព្វផ្សាយនិងប្រាប់អំពីលក្ខណៈពិសេសនៃផលិតផលដល់អតិថិជនសក្តានុពលនៅក្នុងតំបន់-ចូលរួមក្នុងការវាយតម្លៃការងាររបស់ភ្នាក់ងារជាមួយប្រធានគ្រប់គ្រងតំបន់ប្រតិបត្តិការ-ធ្វើការយ៉ាងជិតស្និទ្ធជាមួយមន្ត្រីសម្របសម្រួលតំបន់ និងភ្នាក់ងារដើម្បីកំណត់មូលហេតុនៃការបង់ប្រាក់យឹត ភាពទន់ខ្សោយនៃប្រតិបត្តិការនិងផ្តល់អនុសាសន៍ឱ្យផ្លាស់ប្តូរដើម្បីបង្កើនគុណភាព។-ចរចានិងស្វែងរកដំណោះស្រាយ ជាមួយអតិថិជនបង់យឺត

Company Profile:
MAXIMA MICROFINANCE PLC. was founded in March 2000 with the initial objective and mission of providing loans and financial services to low income clients, individuals, groups, or small and medium businesses (SMEs) which operated 18 branch across Cambodia.

Our Vision
To be the leading Microfinance institution offering micro-financial service with highest quality of customer service.

Our Mission
To provide inclusive financial solution to low income household and SMEs for improving their socio-economic standards in a sustainable way.

Job Description:
- Recruitment, setting up training and rehearsal session to Maxima’s Agent to ensure that they’re properly full understood before allowing them to work and let them aware of their job and responsibilities.
- Make appointment and proceed signing contract agreement with agents
- Prepare handout and loan contract document before training and working
- Collect loan contract documents from field site to Head Office
- Help support Maxima Agent for promotion
- Join for appraisal process of Maxima Agent with Field Managers
- Visit clients in case of late repayment.
- Inform and update situation of field site to field Manager
- Creating plans to help agents improve, track their progress to meet the goals of these plans
- Strongly adhere and follow the guideline and policy of Maxima.
Job Requirement:
- University Degree in Banking, Finance
- Able to handle training session for subordinate
- Must have the ability to make fair and ethical decisions in tough circumstances
- High self-motivation with strong interpersonal skills
- Must have the ability to motivate and persuade others, particularly delinquent clients to repay debt
- Abilities to communicate with local authorities and legal/court members in an articulate and professional manner
- Fluent in Khmer language and intermediate level for English language
- Computer literacy in MS Word, Excel, Power-Point, Internet and E-mail
- Able to travel to provinces for field visit
- Be motivated to help people in need of financial services

Job Description:
	Review management and financial reports, for daily, weekly, monthly, quarterly, half-yearly and annual submission to group, regional, regulators and management
	Manage the team to delivery successful of service, quality and cost within agree time
	Prepare HFM reporting plus commentary to group and regional for CFO’s approval
	Understand and adhere to accounting standards, law and regulations and tax matters subjected to Life Insurance Company to ensure compliance of such matters
	Manage the various projects involving Financial Reporting team to ensure projects and work requests are delivered according to plan.
	Manage and plan to ensure that the team have the requisite skills and resources to achieve and deliver according to plan.
	Manage relationships with key Financial Controllers
	Coordinate the allocation & completion of work requests within the team to ensure they meet agreed turnaround times.
	Monitor team outputs against minimum performance standards/ metrics.
	Ensure the team has a full understanding of relevant internal/external policy and procedural requirements as well as regulatory/statutory requirements. 
	Liaise with Regional office for issues related to reporting requirements, support, problem solving, and others, as required
	Continually improve the team’s awareness of all company policies and procedures.
	Monitor risk trends and issues to increase awareness.
	Engage with external auditors for Financial Year Compulsory Financial Statement
	Deal with regulators and insurance administration for report requirement and submission
Job Requirement:
Experience/Skill:
	Bachelor degree in Economics, Finance, Accounting or equivalent; CAT & ACCA is preferable.
	At least 4-year experience in Finance or audit related field 
	Have strong experience/skills in accounting standard, Cambodia laws and regulation, tax and excels
	Strong communication skills, with care and understanding
	Be able to work best under pressure
	Have at least two years in leading and managing team
	A fast learner and critical thinker

Knowledge:
	Understanding the insurance business is preferable

Company Profile:
Prudential (Cambodia) Life Assurance PLC began operations in Cambodia in January 2013. It is the leading life insurer in Cambodia with more than USD280 million assured and 27,000 policies issued (as at 31 September 2015). One of the first life insurers in Cambodia, Prudential Cambodia is committed to raising the awareness of life insurance among the Cambodian people and helping them protect and secure their financial futures.

Prudential Cambodia is part of UK-based Prudential plc. Founded in 1848, Prudential plc is an international financial services group with significant operations in Asia, the US and the UK. It serves around 25 million insurance customers and have £505 billion of assets under management (as at 30 June 2015). Prudential plc is listed on the stock exchanges in London, Hong Kong, Singapore and New York.

Prudential plc is not affiliated in any manner with Prudential Financial, Inc., a company whose principal place of business is in the United States of America.

Company Profile:
Wing Bank (Cambodia) Plc – the bank for every Cambodian – is driven by the vision to provide every Cambodian with convenient access to financial services relevant to, and for the improvement of their daily lives.

Wing Bank has revolutionized the way Cambodians access financial services by introducing instant, secure, and convenient Mobile Financial Services since 18 August 2008.

Today, Wing Bank serves the entire Cambodian population with 100% coverage of the districts in Cambodia thanks to the innovative Wing Bank App, over 10,000 Wing Cash Xpress agents, over 55,000 merchants, and partnerships with industry giants such as Mastercard, MoneyGram, AliPay, WeChat Pay, Western Union, Visa, and Ria.

Wing Bank provides an array of advanced financial products both for individual and corporate customers. These include loans, deposits, micro savings, credit referral services, money transfers, utility and insurance payments, supply chain payments, payroll services and even phone top-ups. In addition, Wing offers retail payments via “WingPay”, and has also introduced the “WingMall” e-commerce platform.

Both small and large companies alike are now using Wing’s payroll and disbursement services, speeding up their payments. Over 80% of Wing’s agents and 50% of customers are women, making Wing a shining example of gender inclusion in the region.

Wing Bank is committed to providing financial, gender and digital inclusion to the unbanked and the under-banked, allowing every Cambodian to enjoy convenience and security when it comes to financial services
Contact Info: Contact Information HR Department   078 988 290 / 078 989 509 / 078 989 114 jobs@wingbank.com.kh No. 721, Preah Monivong Blvd., Sangkat Beung Keng Kang 3, Khan Chamkar Mon, Phnom Penh, Cambodia 078 988 290 / 078 989 509 / 078 989 114

Company Profile:
Cambodia Beverage Company Ltd (CBC) referred too locally as Coca-Cola Cambodia is a leading manufacturer & distributor of non-alcoholic ready to drink (NARTD) beverages throughout Cambodia. With our state-of-the-art bottling plant (commissioned in 2016) situated within PPSEZ, one of the leading Economic Zones in Phnom Penh.

The company produces 16 different beverages, under 8 brands, and within 5 different NARTD categories (Sparkling, Tea, Energy, Water, and Isotonic) which is supplied to our customers throughout the Kingdom.
CBC directly employs more than 850 staff while creating indirect employment opportunities for another 8,000+ staff across the Kingdom.

We are proud that >99.7% of our workforce are Cambodian nationals and that >31% of our staff are female, with women making up 37% of the senior management team. We are committed to increasing our female diversity and are targeting to have 50% female staff by 2030.
We are committed to integrating sustainability into everything we do.

By 2030 we aim to collect and recycle a bottle or can for each one we sell by 2030 and use at least 50% recycled material in our packaging.
We are committed to return to nature and communities 100%+ of the water we use in our drinks and their production. We are working to increase water security where we operate, source ingredients, and touch people's lives.

Company Profile:
RMA entered the Cambodian market in 1992 as an exclusive provider of dedicated system solutions for commercial and non-commercial enterprises in the sectors of infrastructure, energy and logistics. Gradually, the company has been growing alongside the development of Cambodia and expanded to automotive, agricultural and heavy equipment, warehouse solutions, financial services, car rental and food franchise management.  In addition to business expansion, RMA Cambodia has also focused its attention on human resources by providing internships and employment opportunities to approximately 2,000 local and professional staff with a number of expatriates working together to share their skills and expertise.

RMA Cambodia has also been very active within local communities. We consistently work with local authorities and organizations to provide financial and technical assistance in essential key sectors, such as health, environment, education and sports.

We aim to help Cambodia grow and prosper.

OUR SERVICES AND PRODUCTS:

RMA Cambodia and its affiliate Asia Vehicle Rental (AVR) are offering franchised car rental services through the global brand AVIS. Rentals are customized with brand-new Ford vehicles and experienced English-speaking chauffeurs. AVIS also offers car rental and leasing that meets all types of customers requirements for business trips, leisure or field work, with or without chauffeurs.

RMA Cambodia has a financing arm, RMA Financial Services, offers financing solutions to flexibly meet the needs of corporate and retail customers for the purchase of their own automotive and heavy equipment, agricultural machinery and warehouse solution equipment.

RMA Cambodia is also a provider of heavy equipment products and solutions in construction, road building and maintenance, and agriculture, namely JCB, Mitsubishi FUSO and John Deere. RMA Cambodia is an agent for the world’s leading brands in these industries.
Contact Info: Contact Information EFG Cambodia   017 888 349 efgcareer@rmagroup.net #320, Mao Tse Tong Blvd, Sangkat Tek Laak 1, Khan Toul Kok 017 888 349

job title: Field Organizer USD 600 – USD 700 (Included Tax, insurance, severance pay)
position: Field Organizer USD 600 – USD 700 (Included Tax, insurance, severance pay)
Job Description:
Term of Contract: Annual, full-time
Base Location: Thma Koul OD in Battambang province 
(*Recently, main office of Heart to Heart Foundation Cambodia is located in Siem Reap. The Battambang 
office will be newly opened in June in Battambang town.) 
Start Date: 17 May 2021

Job Summary: Field Organizer will be basically responsible for planning and organizing outreach 
activities such as campaigns, public events, and community meetings for the community awareness and 
participation for the project. 
Information on the Project

Information on the Project 
- Name of Project: Project to Community-based Prevention and Control of Non-Communicable 
Diseases 
- Project Site: Thma koul OD, Battambang province
- Project Period: 1st April 2021- 31st December 2023
- Overall Goal: Contribution to reducing the burden of Non-Communicable Disease in Battambang 
- Project Purpose: Strengthening community based Non-Communicable Disease prevention and 
control
- Project Outcomes ▪ Strengthening Primary Health Service for NCD prevention and control
▪ Increasing NCD awareness for community
▪ Strengthening governance for NCD at targeted OD level
Core Functions
The Field Organizer is responsible to provide overall leadership and management to the community based 
activities of H2H Cambodia NCD project. He/she will be responsible for ensuring smoothly operations, 
achieving the project objectives and goals which were identified in the approved proposals and support 
technical of project implementation such as design project, implementation, monitoring and evaluation. 
He/she will be ensuring collaboration, representing projects of H2H Cambodia with various stakeholders 
and partners, government agencies and local authorities are well communicated to achieve project 
objectives. Major Responsibilities
- Produce project documents in English such as official letters, reports, presentation slides and meeting 
minutes.
- Provide assistance to international staff as interpreter or translator in English.
- Implement activities of Non-Communicable Disease prevention and control project working together 
with public health providers from referral hospital and health centers.
- Facilitate training and workshops in cooperation with health staff.
- Interview patients, caretakers and health staff to conduct various kinds of survey and analyze the data.
- Find a solution for various issues in cooperation with team members and counterparts.
- Expand trustful relationship with counterparts (PHD, OD, RH, PRH, HC/VHSG), other NGOs, patients and 
caretakers with sincere attitude and respect to these stakeholders.
- In addition to the duties stated above, the employee shall perform other duties as assigned by the 
supervisor.
Job Requirement:
- Must be a Battambang resident.
- Thma Koul residents are prioritized.
- Excellent and professional oral and written communication skills in English and Khmer. 
- Bachelor degree in health, nutrition, social work, development studies or related fields.
- At least 3-year work experience in development or public health-related areas.
- Understanding on Cambodia public health system
- Good knowledge and experience in program or project design, planning, implementation, monitoring, 
evaluation, project financial management and report writing
- Strong communication, interpersonal and organizational skills 
- Computer proficient in MS word, Excel, spreadsheet, powerpoint and the internet
- Creative and flexible thinking and proactive attitude to new experiences and challenges.
- Strong commitment to the mission and vision of H2H
- Strong commitment and compassion to community and underprivileged people

Closing date of application: Wednesday, 5 May 2021, at 5:00pm
* Only short-listed for interview will be contacted by email and Interviews will be commenced by Online
(Zoom) within 2days after closing date of application. 
Please send your CV with a cover letter written by yourself, recent photo and two names of references 
(References from your most recent employers are appreciated) to staff in charge by E-mail(ojt@heartheart.org) only.
Tel: 095 535 477, Website: http://www.heart-heart.org/eng/
E-mail (ojt@heart-heart.org
Company Profile:
Heart to Heart Foundation Cambodia, a South Korean non-governmental humanitarian organization working for 
 underprivileged children and their families in poverty and diseases since 2006, is pleased to  announce a vacant position working for the Field Organizer, Non-communicable diseases prevention and  control Project based in Battambang province which is newly launching.
Contact Info: Contact Information HR Department    095 535 477  ojt@heart-heart.org Thma Koul OD in Battambang province  095 535 477

Company Profile:
Cambodia Beverage Company Ltd (CBC) referred too locally as Coca-Cola Cambodia is a leading manufacturer & distributor of non-alcoholic ready to drink (NARTD) beverages throughout Cambodia. With our state-of-the-art bottling plant (commissioned in 2016) situated within PPSEZ, one of the leading Economic Zones in Phnom Penh.

The company produces 16 different beverages, under 8 brands, and within 5 different NARTD categories (Sparkling, Tea, Energy, Water, and Isotonic) which is supplied to our customers throughout the Kingdom.
CBC directly employs more than 850 staff while creating indirect employment opportunities for another 8,000+ staff across the Kingdom.

We are proud that >99.7% of our workforce are Cambodian nationals and that >31% of our staff are female, with women making up 37% of the senior management team. We are committed to increasing our female diversity and are targeting to have 50% female staff by 2030.
We are committed to integrating sustainability into everything we do.

By 2030 we aim to collect and recycle a bottle or can for each one we sell by 2030 and use at least 50% recycled material in our packaging.
We are committed to return to nature and communities 100%+ of the water we use in our drinks and their production. We are working to increase water security where we operate, source ingredients, and touch people's lives.
Contact Info: Contact Information TALENT ACQUISITION TEAM  010 325 777 / 096 48 99 677 / 096 355 6214 / 012 916 444 hrd@coca-cola.com.kh No.287, National Road 5, Mittapheap Village, Russey Keo District, Phnom Penh,  Kingdom of Cambodia. 010 325 777 / 096 48 99 677 / 096 355 6214 / 012 916 444

Job Description:
•	Calculation of the policy liabilities and required capital for demonstration of statutory solvency in accordance with local regulations and actuarial principles. Prepare reports on the statutory solvency position. Perform analysis to ensure optimal capital management for the company.
•	Preparation of financial results on various basis, including IFRS and EEV with accuracy, on a timely basis, on sound principles after thorough analysis.
•	 Modeling and profit testing of new products. 
•	Performing regular experience analyses in relation to expenses, claims and persistency.
•	Maintenance of reinsurance systems, preparation of accounts, and the assessment, documentation and update of reinsurance treaties.
•	Work closely with peers in the Finance team for financial reporting and budgeting & forecasting.
•	Sitting for and passing actuarial exams of a recognized professional actuarial association.
Job Requirement:
Required:
•	Must be a graduate, in a discipline which includes significant mathematical content, from a reputable institution. 
•	Good conceptual, analytical and financial skills.


Desirable:
•	Proficiency with MS Office desirable.
•	Understanding of accounting principles desirable.
•	Strong communication skills, MS Office, influencing & presentation skills.

“ Prudential (Cambodia) Life Assurance PLC provides equal opportunities to all candidates regardless gender, religious, race, age, social origin based on their merit and non-discriminated qualifications. We believe in diversity in our employee population and make sure the employees have proper guidelines for selection and recruitment process. “
Company Profile:
Prudential (Cambodia) Life Assurance PLC began operations in Cambodia in January 2013. It is the leading life insurer in Cambodia with more than USD280 million assured and 27,000 policies issued (as at 31 September 2015). One of the first life insurers in Cambodia, Prudential Cambodia is committed to raising the awareness of life insurance among the Cambodian people and helping them protect and secure their financial futures.

Prudential Cambodia is part of UK-based Prudential plc. Founded in 1848, Prudential plc is an international financial services group with significant operations in Asia, the US and the UK. It serves around 25 million insurance customers and have £505 billion of assets under management (as at 30 June 2015). Prudential plc is listed on the stock exchanges in London, Hong Kong, Singapore and New York.

Prudential plc is not affiliated in any manner with Prudential Financial, Inc., a company whose principal place of business is in the United States of America.
Contact Info: Contact Information PCLA Recruitment HR Manager 087333908 pclarecruitment@prudential.com.kh Phnom Penh Tower, 20F, #445 Monivong Blvd, Boeung Prolit, 7 Makara, Phnom Penh 087333908

Job Description: Program Management•	Responsible for managing all operations and administrative management including ensuring accelerated pace of programme development and its progress, liaison with multi and bi-lateral stake holders •	Responsibility for ensuring targeted results and impact in the development and implementation of the program with operational support and guidance from the IDH HQ Program Management Team and LABS Lead•	Run the required Cambodia program facilitation, administration, and reporting within the overall regional structure•	Manages contracts with implementing partners, Inspection Firms, Training Firms, and consultants (with legal and administrative support of the IDH Operations team Stakeholder Management and Networking•	Promoting LABS programme to expand its Outreach•	Responsibility for working on the maintenance and expansion of the relevant network in the sector•	Manage and support public sector engagement •	Managing partnerships with key stakeholders and Governments.Supporting the Requirements•	Proven ability to establish strong relationships and build rapport with stakeholders and       clients •	Strong communication skills, both written and verbal in English (essential)•	Ability to think conceptually around complex issues•	Experience in project management and leadership of teams•	Minimum of 10 years of work experience and 5 in a leadership role•	Must have a bachelor’s degree and above.•	Prior engineering experience and or work in the Apparel & Footwear sector would be a bonus.•	Willingness to travel.
Job Requirement: Strategic Program Development•	Contribute constructively to strategic planning, operational, financial, and managerial leadership for successful implementation of programme activities in the country. •	Institutionalize Strong Systems and Processes for the programme development consistent with funder and stakeholder priorities and direction   •	Advancing at country level, country related work of the programme
Company Profile: LABS Initiative is an industry-driven program, in which multiple brands and retailers are joining forces with public organizations to operate a scalable program to mitigate preventable fire, electrical and structural safety risks in key apparel and footwear producing countries in a targeted way.Many workers in key apparel producing countries work in unsafe environments which can have lethal consequences. That is why it is the mission of the Life and Building Safety (LABS) Initiative to provide safer working conditions for factory workers in the apparel and footwear industry.We organize our activities around identifying and solving risks related to fire and electrical hazards, structural building safety, and evacuation, so workers can lead better lives.This is done by developing country-specific solutions. Here, we create a life-safety program that delivers a harmonized framework for monitoring, assessment, risk reduction, and remediation.More details of the LABS Initiative can be read on its website: (http://www.labsinitiative.com)
Contact Info: Contact Information Hang Phan CS Manager  phan@labsinitiative.com Phnom Penh hwgg+37 phnom penh

Company Profile:
RMA entered the Cambodian market in 1992 as an exclusive provider of dedicated system solutions for commercial and non-commercial enterprises in the sectors of infrastructure, energy and logistics. Gradually, the company has been growing alongside the development of Cambodia and expanded to automotive, agricultural and heavy equipment, warehouse solutions, financial services, car rental and food franchise management.  In addition to business expansion, RMA Cambodia has also focused its attention on human resources by providing internships and employment opportunities to approximately 2,000 local and professional staff with a number of expatriates working together to share their skills and expertise.

RMA Cambodia has also been very active within local communities. We consistently work with local authorities and organizations to provide financial and technical assistance in essential key sectors, such as health, environment, education and sports.

We aim to help Cambodia grow and prosper.

OUR SERVICES AND PRODUCTS:

RMA Cambodia and its affiliate Asia Vehicle Rental (AVR) are offering franchised car rental services through the global brand AVIS. Rentals are customized with brand-new Ford vehicles and experienced English-speaking chauffeurs. AVIS also offers car rental and leasing that meets all types of customers requirements for business trips, leisure or field work, with or without chauffeurs.

RMA Cambodia has a financing arm, RMA Financial Services, offers financing solutions to flexibly meet the needs of corporate and retail customers for the purchase of their own automotive and heavy equipment, agricultural machinery and warehouse solution equipment.

RMA Cambodia is also a provider of heavy equipment products and solutions in construction, road building and maintenance, and agriculture, namely JCB, Mitsubishi FUSO and John Deere. RMA Cambodia is an agent for the world’s leading brands in these industries.
Contact Info: Contact Information RMA CAMBODIA  017888390 recruitment.kh@rmagroup.net #27, St. 134, SangkatMittapheap, Khan 7 Makara, Phnom Penh 017888390

Company Profile:
From a very humble beginning as a small roofing sheet roll former in 1997, ISI STEEL, A member of ISI GROUP, has successfully transformed itself from a family-run business into a midsize corporation leading Cambodia's steel processing industry. With modern processing facilities, world-class management systems and technology, dedicated staff and nationwide distribution networks serving our customers nationwide, ISI STEEL has become a truly reliable and respectable local brand synonymous with quality roofing and wall cladding systems and structural steel products.

This would not have been possible without the strong support of our customers, local and international business partners, our staff's dedication and hard work, and last but not least the government efforts for maintaining the political stability and sustainable economic growth. To ensure our company’s sustainable development and industry-leading position, we are committed to further invest in upgrading our manufacturing facilities, expanding our distribution network, building up our human capital, technology infrastructure, and product innovations to better meet our customer's need and expectation.

While continuing to strengthen our core capabilities in the manufacturing and distribution of quality coated steel products, we have over the years ventured into a number of related diversifications such as pre-engineering steel building fabrication, property development including industrial park, residential, offices and resorts developments, and other construction materials trading business through our subsidiary and affiliated companies to capture the opportunities in the growing economy of Cambodia.
Contact Info: Contact Information Recruitment Team  010-484-535 /092-484-535 recruitment@isisteel.com.kh Phum Tropang Thloeung, St,Veng Sreng ,Sangkat Chaom Chao, Khan Phor Sen Chey, Phnom Penh, Cambodia 010-484-535 /092-484-535

Job Description:

Company Profile:
Wing Bank (Cambodia) Plc – the bank for every Cambodian – is driven by the vision to provide every Cambodian with convenient access to financial services relevant to, and for the improvement of their daily lives.

Wing Bank has revolutionized the way Cambodians access financial services by introducing instant, secure, and convenient Mobile Financial Services since 18 August 2008.

Today, Wing Bank serves the entire Cambodian population with 100% coverage of the districts in Cambodia thanks to the innovative Wing Bank App, over 10,000 Wing Cash Xpress agents, over 55,000 merchants, and partnerships with industry giants such as Mastercard, MoneyGram, AliPay, WeChat Pay, Western Union, Visa, and Ria.

Wing Bank provides an array of advanced financial products both for individual and corporate customers. These include loans, deposits, micro savings, credit referral services, money transfers, utility and insurance payments, supply chain payments, payroll services and even phone top-ups. In addition, Wing offers retail payments via “WingPay”, and has also introduced the “WingMall” e-commerce platform.

Both small and large companies alike are now using Wing’s payroll and disbursement services, speeding up their payments. Over 80% of Wing’s agents and 50% of customers are women, making Wing a shining example of gender inclusion in the region.

Wing Bank is committed to providing financial, gender and digital inclusion to the unbanked and the under-banked, allowing every Cambodian to enjoy convenience and security when it comes to financial services
Contact Info: Contact Information HR Department   078 988 290 / 078 989 509 / 078 989 114 jobs@wingbank.com.kh No. 721, Preah Monivong Blvd., Sangkat Beung Keng Kang 3, Khan Chamkar Mon, Phnom Penh, Cambodia 078 988 290 / 078 989 509 / 078 989 114

Job Description:
Position Summary:
- Expedite full processes of landside and customs activities to ensure that shipments are arranged and delivered on time as customers’ expectations
- Coordinate with all related parties/ stakeholders to ensure smooth operations and problem solving on timely manner
- Deliver services performance & customers’ KPIs; proactively initiate preventive and corrective action plans for further improvement.
- Be responsible for job costing, following-up billing and payment in timely manner

Key Responsibilities:
- Expedite daily operations landside and customs activities of assigned accounts
- Proper co-ordination with Customers, Customer Service teams, CFS Warehouse and 3PL provider for stuffing plan and/to arrange services on scheduled, for timely collection and dispatch of shipments.
- Proactively attend all the inquiries from Customers and Customer Service teams, well communication with related parties in case of exceptions.
- Prepare SOPs & IOPs in collaboration with Customer, Sale, Procurement, Implementation and Products and 3PL providers
- Take ownership of the issues and perform problem resolution.
- Ensuring compliance to internal & external audit controls; process efficiency and delivering operational KPIs.
- Drive operational excellence through KPI measurement and analysis.
- Able to work independently with the limit supervision from higher level.
- Enhance productivity & performance with initiatives in operation.
- Actively contribute initiatives to support process improvements, payment process with cost-saving requirement. 
- Take every opportunity to expand on services in scope of solution design and new business development.
- Carry out ad-hoc tasks assigned by Team Leader/ Manager
Job Requirement:
- Possess 2+ years’ experience related working experience in Import - Export Operation 
• Possess practical knowledge & experience in customs formalities operations, preferred (not mandatory) to customs formalities at border gate; and knowledge in regulation on specialized inspection; 
• Familiar with handling transportation (inland/ domestic transportation and cross borders)
• Experience in working and managing vendors/ sub-contractors
• Possess practical knowledge & Experience in customs formalities operations & transportation handling: container pick up/drop off; OOG container handling.
• Processing for apply Certificate of origin/ quality, HS code classification
- Experience in price consultation of customs, tax refund, post-clearance inspection and year-end Customs finalization report will be a plus
- Computer literacy, especially in outlook email, excel, power point
- English 
- Possess can-do and willing-to-do attitude
- Teamwork, Discipline and Integrity
Company Profile:
The A.P. Moller – Maersk Group was founded in 1904 in Denmark. Since then, the Group has grown into the largest shipping & logistics provider in the world. It has more than 300 offices and representations in over 100 countries worldwide employing more than 76,000 people. The activities, apart from shipping and logistics, include industry, retail, shipbuilding as well as oil & gas exploration.

Maersk Cambodia, its affiliated company, has been supporting the Cambodian trade since 1992, being one of the first international container shipping companies to serve the Cambodian market. It remains one of the largest container shipping lines operating in Cambodia today.
Contact Info: Contact Information Mr. Chanra  +855 2396 5671 / +855 96 673 6482 von.chanra@maersk.com 	VTrust Tower- 7th floor, No. Plot A, Street 169, Phum 12, Sangkat Vealvong, Khan 7 Makara Cambodia +855 2396 5671 / +855 96 673 6482

Job Description:

company_name: Asian T A C T Co.,Ltd
Job Description:
1. Duties & responsibilities 
** Duties and objectives of this role 
‐ Creating, communicating and implementing organization’s vision, mission, core  value, goal, and direction for grow, flourish, profitable, and sustainable 
‐ Leading the development, implementation and execution of long‐term strategies with the goal of increasing shareholder value 
‐ Soliciting advice and guiding when appropriate from Board of Directors or Shareholders, and evaluating executive leaders 
‐ Develop strategic plans for optimized productivity 
‐ Review and improve organizational effectiveness by developing process, overseeing employees, establishing a highly motivated working environment, and creating 
innovative approaches for improvement 
‐ Seek out opportunities for expansion and growth by developing new business relationships 
‐ Provide guidance and feedback to help others for internal strengthen specific knowledge or skill, and improve their weakness of knowledge or skill areas 

** Daily and monthly responsibilities 
‐ Oversee day‐to‐day operations, assigning weekly performance target and goals, and assuring their completion as aligned and agreed together 
‐ Build and maintain profitable partnerships with key stakeholders 
‐ Review and improve organizational effectiveness by developing process, overseeing employees, establishing a highly motivated work environment, and creating 
innovative approaches for improvement 
‐ Formulating and implementing the strategic plan that guides the direction of all staff by departments, product, service, business, and company 
‐ Recruit, on board, and train high‐performing employees to achieve sales, profitability, sales trend, sales distribution channel, market share, and business plan 
objectives 
‐ Create and develop of weekly or monthly wine tasting, event, project timelines to ensure tasks are accomplished on time as aligned with budget 
‐ Develop and implement commercial strategies according to company goals and objectives aiming to accelerate growth 
‐ Develop, implement, and maintain budgetary and resource allocation plans  
‐ B2B & B2C strategy and program with product portfolios, releasing a new product, and looking for ways to aggressively grow the business 
‐ Sub‐distributor or wine agent activation plan, Phnom Penh and provincial sales distribution channel in order to improve, achieve sales target, and revenues  ‐ Increasing of product available & brand awareness among targeted audience  
‐ Focus on strong distribution channel both down town to sub‐urban to rural area (City/province, district/Khan, commune/Sangkat, village, group)
‐ Create and develop sales strategy by reconfigure RTM, focus on in‐outlet execution & implementation of route management, trade and consumer promotional program 
and supporting other activities, primary and secondary sales from company to distributors, sub‐distributors, business partner, key accounts, wholesalers, retailer, and end user in the whole region‐nationwide  
‐ Develop and provide weekly, monthly, quarterly sales training with the real of daily job performance, implementation, execution, and best practice 
‐ Recruiting and activating distributor, sub‐distributor, and business partners (third party) by province as aligned working calendar and deadline/timeline 
‐ Train sales team of product knowledge, provide document support‐sales kids, product display standard, merchandising, market execution, route to market 
‐ Weekly route riding and coaching program by spending suitable time on the field with Sales Manager, Sales Supervisor, and sales team members by setting schedule‐
it’s call on the job coaching program with all levels 
‐ Understand the requirements of existing customers to ensure their needs and wants are being met and achieved 
‐ Empower and delegate responsibilities to the best employees to perform them while enforcing all policies, procedures, standards, specifications, guidelines, training 
programs, and culture value 
‐ Resolve internal staff conflicts efficiently and to the mutual benefit of those involved 
‐ Direct report to CEO, weekly and monthly report to CEO and shareholders
Job Requirement:
‐ Bachelor or master’s degree in business management or related field 
‐ At least 7‐10 experiences in FMCG, and 3‐5 years proven experience in managerial role or senior management role, or experience from wine industry is preferred.  
‐ Excellent in English both verbal and written communication 
‐ Solid presentation skills and ability to explain complex processes to shareholders and employees 
‐ Strong decision‐making capabilities, collaboration, delegation, problem solving skills  
‐ Ability to motivate, support and lead people, training, coaching and hold employees accountable by levels    
‐ Planning and managing the company’s performance 
‐ Manage operations and processes within budget and deadline 
‐ Expert in sales, marketing, financial management and persistent business to succeed 
‐ Ability to enforce and maintain high standards, even under pressure 
‐ Strong working knowledge of operational procedures, knowledge of human resource process, and previous performance evaluation experience  
‐ Proven ability to develop and maintain of financial plans, product costing, P&L

Job Description:
- Conducts weekly meetings with respective business units.

- At least 2 to 3 years of experience in Human Resource Management.
- Ability to comprehend, interpret, and apply the appropriate sections of applicable laws, guidelines, regulations, ordinances, and policies.
- Ability to acquire a thorough understanding of the organization’s hierarchy, jobs, qualifications, compensation practices, and the administrative practices related to those factors.

Company Profile:
Starting from 1951 in Texas, United States, Circle K is now one of  the most widely recognized convenience store brands, known worldwide for  quality products & great customer service with more than 15.000  associates worldwide including Hong Kong, China, Vietnam, Indonesia,  UAE, Macau, Mexico, Honduras, Guam, Malaysia, The Philippines, Egypt  & Costa Rica…

At Circle K Cambodia, our mission is to be the best and most convenient place for all of your daily shopping needs.

Vision
To be the leading No 1 Neighborhood Convenience Store in Cambodia providing 24 hours conveniences, exclusive merchandise and value added services to our customers.

Mission
To Make Our Customer Life’s a Little Easier Everyday

Core Value
1- Customer Focus: Customer are the reason for our success in Business and we are committed to listen and respond positively to their need.
2- Integrity: Honest, Trustworthy, Adhere to Strong Moral and Ethical Principle and Value.
3- Teamwork: one team, one goal and one direction – with collaboration, share and support each other.
4- Accountability: taking ownership for a task or role and committed to execute and deliver result.
5- Courtesy & Respect: treating other people the way you want to be treated.
6- Continuous Growth: Proactive to Adapt to Instance change.
7- Excellent: Aim for higher quality and accuracy, usually above performance standard.

Currently Circle K Cambodia is having more than 35 Store locate in the following:
- Phnnom Penh
- Siem Reap

Job Description:

- Strong organizational skills

Company Profile:
RMA entered the Cambodian market in 1992 as an exclusive provider of dedicated system solutions for commercial and non-commercial enterprises in the sectors of infrastructure, energy and logistics. Gradually, the company has been growing alongside the development of Cambodia and expanded to automotive, agricultural and heavy equipment, warehouse solutions, financial services, car rental and food franchise management.  In addition to business expansion, RMA Cambodia has also focused its attention on human resources by providing internships and employment opportunities to approximately 2,000 local and professional staff with a number of expatriates working together to share their skills and expertise.

RMA Cambodia has also been very active within local communities. We consistently work with local authorities and organizations to provide financial and technical assistance in essential key sectors, such as health, environment, education and sports.

We aim to help Cambodia grow and prosper.

OUR SERVICES AND PRODUCTS:

RMA Cambodia and its affiliate Asia Vehicle Rental (AVR) are offering franchised car rental services through the global brand AVIS. Rentals are customized with brand-new Ford vehicles and experienced English-speaking chauffeurs. AVIS also offers car rental and leasing that meets all types of customers requirements for business trips, leisure or field work, with or without chauffeurs.

RMA Cambodia has a financing arm, RMA Financial Services, offers financing solutions to flexibly meet the needs of corporate and retail customers for the purchase of their own automotive and heavy equipment, agricultural machinery and warehouse solution equipment.

RMA Cambodia is also a provider of heavy equipment products and solutions in construction, road building and maintenance, and agriculture, namely JCB, Mitsubishi FUSO and John Deere. RMA Cambodia is an agent for the world’s leading brands in these industries.

Job Description:
- Write high quality code using the guidelines and effectively debug the code
- Implement low to medium complexity system enhancement to meed manage the day-to-day activities of the assigned teams providing guidance and support removing barriers as needed

- Good foundation in data structures, algorithms, and OO Design with rock-solid programming skills

adhering to ISO and standards

leadership skills across project and business team

frameworks, and Rest Service framework with Tomcat, WebLogic, or other similar frameworks

job title: បុគ្គលិកផ្នែកលក់ ខាងក្នុង​និងក្រៅហាង​​
position: បុគ្គលិកផ្នែកលក់ ខាងក្នុង​និងក្រៅហាង​​
Job Description:
- ស្វែងរកនិងកំណត់អតិថិជនគោលដៅ
- រៀបចំការណាត់និងចុះជួបអតិថិជនដោយផ្ទាល់
- ពន្យល់ណែនាំនូវទំនិញនិងសេវាកម្មរបស់ក្រុមហ៊ុនដល់អតិថិជន
- ស្វែងយល់ពីតំរូវការរបស់អតិថិជន
- រៀបចំផែនការនិងយុទ្ធសាស្ត្រលក់ដើម្បីធានាអោយបាននូវគោលដៅលក់របស់ក្រុមហ៊ុន
- ពង្រីកសក្តានុពលទីផ្សារអោយកាន់តែធំទូលាយ
- រៀចំរបាយការណ៏ប្រចាំ ថ្ងៃ និងសប្តាហ៏
- យកចិត្តទុកដាក់និងធ្វើបច្ចុប្បន្នភាពពត៏មានថ្មីៗដល់អតិថិជន
- បំពេញភារកិច្ចចាំបាច់ផ្សេងៗដែលត្រូវបានប្រគល់ដោយថ្នាក់ដឹកនាំ
Job Requirement:
- រូបសម្បតិ្តសមរម្យ
- មានសេចក្តីក្លាហាន ឈ្លាសវៃ ច្នៃប្រឌិតនិងទទួលខុសត្រូវខ្ពស់
- ត្រៀមលក្ខណះគ្រប់គ្រាន់ដើម្បីប្រកួតប្រជែងទីផ្សារ
- សញ្ញាប័ត្រទុតិយភូមិ និស្សិតមហាវិទ្យាល័យឬបញ្ចប់បរិញ្ញាប័ត្រ
- មានចំណេះដឹងផ្នែកភាសាអង់គ្លេស (សរសេរ និយាយ​ អាន និងស្តាប់បាន)
- ចំណេះដឹងមូលដ្ធានផ្នែកកុំព្យូទ័រ (Microsoft Word Excel) 
- មានបទពិសោធន៏ផ្នែកលក់ផលិតផល
- អាចធ្វើការងារជាក្រុមនិងផ្តល់លទ្ធផលតាមពេលវាលាកំណត់បាន
- អាចធ្វើដំណើរទៅលក់នៅតាមខេត្តបាន
- ធ្ចើការ៨ម៉ោងក្នុង១ថ្ងៃនិង៦ថ្ងៃក្នុង១សប្តាហ៏

*** អត្ថប្រយោជន៏់
- បៀវត្សន៏ប្រចាំខែពី២៥០ដុល្លារទៅ៣០០ ដុល្លារនិងកំរៃជើងសារ(Commission) ដែលបានពីការលក់ផលិតផល
- ទទួលបាននូវការបណ្តុះបណ្តាលជំនាញលក់បន្ថែម
- ក្រុមហ៊ុនមានរថយន្តសម្រាប់អ្នកលក់ចុះទីផ្សារ

job title: Senior Officer, IT Security and Compliance
position: Senior Officer, IT Security and Compliance
Job Description:
- Provide the excellent supports on overall aspects of Information Security, IT Governance, IT Risk, IT Audit and IT Compliance;
- Perform IT risk assessment and produce actionable plan to secure bank’s application, data and networks.
- Monitoring network usage to ensure compliance with security policies.
- Assess and develop up to date with IT security policy, standards and threats.
- Collaborate with management and the related IT department to improve security posture.
- Document any security breaches and assessing their damage.
- Coordinate and update information security incident response document, ensuring processes and procedures are tested regularly in line with IT continuity, business continuity planning (BCP) and disaster recovery (DR) policy
- Promote cyber security awareness posture at all levels of management and employees, by maintaining and developing a
positive culture of compliance against IT security policy, industry standards and regulations;
- Identify and address a full range of issues from structure and policy, through to assisting in specific areas such as data privacy; data leakage prevention / monitoring; information rights management; third party security and cryptography;
- Perform day to day IT security operation required by head of departments and management.
- Minimize all risks including operational, information and cyber security risk
Company Profile:
Phillip Bank Plc. is a member of PhillipCapital Group which is headquartered in Singapore, and established since 1975. The Group offers a full range of quality and innovative services to retail, corporate and institutional customers and currently operates in over 15 countries including Australia, Cambodia, China (as well as Hong Kong), France, India, Indonesia, Japan, Malaysia, Singapore, Thailand, Turkey, UK, UAE, USA and Vietnam.  

We were established in Cambodia in 2009 under HwangDBS Commercial Bank Plc. and in 2014, PhillipCapital Group bought it over and renamed it as Phillip Bank. In year 2020, the merger between Phillip Bank Plc. and KREDIT Microfinance Institution Plc. concluded successfully and made us one of the largest commercial bank with more than 70 branches in Cambodia.

Employee experience is our priority in Phillip Bank, in the process of achieving our corporate goals, we will put every effort towards our people’s growth. We are proud of our bank’s culture where: We treat our employee as family members; we always strive to meet our customer’s expectation and we believe in benefitting the communities.

Job Description:

- Performance tuning experience related to reporting queries
- Understand key Financial and Banking concepts

- Creative, good problem solving and research skills


* PhillipBank provides competitive salary (based on experience and performance) and benefits as follows:

Company Profile:
Phillip Bank Plc. is a member of PhillipCapital Group which is headquartered in Singapore, and established since 1975. The Group offers a full range of quality and innovative services to retail, corporate and institutional customers and currently operates in over 15 countries including Australia, Cambodia, China (as well as Hong Kong), France, India, Indonesia, Japan, Malaysia, Singapore, Thailand, Turkey, UK, UAE, USA and Vietnam.  

We were established in Cambodia in 2009 under HwangDBS Commercial Bank Plc. and in 2014, PhillipCapital Group bought it over and renamed it as Phillip Bank. In year 2020, the merger between Phillip Bank Plc. and KREDIT Microfinance Institution Plc. concluded successfully and made us one of the largest commercial bank with more than 70 branches in Cambodia.

Employee experience is our priority in Phillip Bank, in the process of achieving our corporate goals, we will put every effort towards our people’s growth. We are proud of our bank’s culture where: We treat our employee as family members; we always strive to meet our customer’s expectation and we believe in benefitting the communities.

Company Profile:
RMA entered the Cambodian market in 1992 as an exclusive provider of dedicated system solutions for commercial and non-commercial enterprises in the sectors of infrastructure, energy and logistics. Gradually, the company has been growing alongside the development of Cambodia and expanded to automotive, agricultural and heavy equipment, warehouse solutions, financial services, car rental and food franchise management.  In addition to business expansion, RMA Cambodia has also focused its attention on human resources by providing internships and employment opportunities to approximately 2,000 local and professional staff with a number of expatriates working together to share their skills and expertise.

RMA Cambodia has also been very active within local communities. We consistently work with local authorities and organizations to provide financial and technical assistance in essential key sectors, such as health, environment, education and sports.

We aim to help Cambodia grow and prosper.

OUR SERVICES AND PRODUCTS:

RMA Cambodia and its affiliate Asia Vehicle Rental (AVR) are offering franchised car rental services through the global brand AVIS. Rentals are customized with brand-new Ford vehicles and experienced English-speaking chauffeurs. AVIS also offers car rental and leasing that meets all types of customers requirements for business trips, leisure or field work, with or without chauffeurs.

RMA Cambodia has a financing arm, RMA Financial Services, offers financing solutions to flexibly meet the needs of corporate and retail customers for the purchase of their own automotive and heavy equipment, agricultural machinery and warehouse solution equipment.

RMA Cambodia is also a provider of heavy equipment products and solutions in construction, road building and maintenance, and agriculture, namely JCB, Mitsubishi FUSO and John Deere. RMA Cambodia is an agent for the world’s leading brands in these industries.

“ Prudential (Cambodia) Life Assurance PLC provides equal opportunities to all candidates regardless gender, religious, race, age, social origin based on their merit and non-discriminated qualifications. We believe in diversity in our employee population and make sure the employees have proper guidelines for selection and recruitment process. “
Company Profile:
Prudential (Cambodia) Life Assurance PLC began operations in Cambodia in January 2013. It is the leading life insurer in Cambodia with more than USD280 million assured and 27,000 policies issued (as at 31 September 2015). One of the first life insurers in Cambodia, Prudential Cambodia is committed to raising the awareness of life insurance among the Cambodian people and helping them protect and secure their financial futures.

Prudential Cambodia is part of UK-based Prudential plc. Founded in 1848, Prudential plc is an international financial services group with significant operations in Asia, the US and the UK. It serves around 25 million insurance customers and have £505 billion of assets under management (as at 30 June 2015). Prudential plc is listed on the stock exchanges in London, Hong Kong, Singapore and New York.

Prudential plc is not affiliated in any manner with Prudential Financial, Inc., a company whose principal place of business is in the United States of America.

Job Description:
- Collects and compiles HR metrics and data from a variety of sources including the human resource information system, employee surveys, exit interviews, employment records, familiar industry practices, and other sources.
- Analyzes data and statistics for trends and patterns with attention to retention, turnover and compliance with employment laws and regulations.
- Analyzes competitive compensation practices in the job market and contributes to established compensation surveys
- Maintains and updates compensation databases and the job description
- Assists in the development and updating HR policies, guidelines, and procedures.
- Work closely with stakeholders to ensure digitization processes met the deadline.
Job Requirement:
- Bachelor degree in Human Resources, Business Administration or related field required.
- At least two years of experience in related areas such as job classification and compensation, employee benefits, and/or equal opportunity compliance preferred.
- Good analytical skills
- Good working with big spreadsheets.
- Proficient with Microsoft Office or related software.
Company Profile:
Wing Bank (Cambodia) Plc – the bank for every Cambodian – is driven by the vision to provide every Cambodian with convenient access to financial services relevant to, and for the improvement of their daily lives.

Wing Bank has revolutionized the way Cambodians access financial services by introducing instant, secure, and convenient Mobile Financial Services since 18 August 2008.

Today, Wing Bank serves the entire Cambodian population with 100% coverage of the districts in Cambodia thanks to the innovative Wing Bank App, over 10,000 Wing Cash Xpress agents, over 55,000 merchants, and partnerships with industry giants such as Mastercard, MoneyGram, AliPay, WeChat Pay, Western Union, Visa, and Ria.

Wing Bank provides an array of advanced financial products both for individual and corporate customers. These include loans, deposits, micro savings, credit referral services, money transfers, utility and insurance payments, supply chain payments, payroll services and even phone top-ups. In addition, Wing offers retail payments via “WingPay”, and has also introduced the “WingMall” e-commerce platform.

Both small and large companies alike are now using Wing’s payroll and disbursement services, speeding up their payments. Over 80% of Wing’s agents and 50% of customers are women, making Wing a shining example of gender inclusion in the region.

Wing Bank is committed to providing financial, gender and digital inclusion to the unbanked and the under-banked, allowing every Cambodian to enjoy convenience and security when it comes to financial services
Contact Info: Contact Information HR Department   078 988 290 / 078 989 509 / 078 989 114 jobs@wingbank.com.kh No. 721, Preah Monivong Blvd., Sangkat Beung Keng Kang 3, Khan Chamkar Mon, Phnom Penh, Cambodia 078 988 290 / 078 989 509 / 078 989 114
