- Ability to advocate the product internally and externally for the full picture and awareness so to gain the support from all stakeholders
- initiate performance/ product survey/ research independently or lead agency to Identify the gap and give strategic recommendations to achieve the business objectives.
- Drive or lead various implementation initiatives cross-functionally, to make the initiatives happen
Job Requirement:
- BA/ MBA in Marketing or Management or Economics
- At least 4 years’ experience in marketing, management, analytics.
- Knowledge in Brand/ product / portfolio management
- Marketing management
- Project management
- Business communications
- FinTech/ bankin

job title: Sales Manager (06 Vacancies) - to be based in PV, SVR, OM, MK,  KS, and KK
position: Sales Manager (06 Vacancies) - to be based in PV, SVR, OM, MK,  KS, and KK
Location: Kampong Speu，Koh Kong，Mondulkiri，Oddor Meanchey，Prey Veng，Svay Rieng
Job Description:
•Direct, motivate, & support professional sales team to accomplish their Objectives.
•Manage sales activities and daily sales deal status in Odoo-CRM, expenses reporting, and cross-functional reporting (such as Stock, Service, BPD, etc.) with own area of responsibility. Grow network with own area of responsibility!
•Accountable for ensuring all RMA’s policies and procedures are followed within the showrooms and/or responsible area.
•Advice sales team throughout the sales process, including but not limited to prospecting -> closing sales.
•	Coach and mentor sales team on the following topics; including but not limited to needs, features & benefits, closing deals, time and territory management, negotiating, product knowledge, and productivity improvement.
•Create and monitor annual sales department benchmarks and budget, in alignment with the organization’s financial and operational objectives.
•Ensure customer satisfaction. Work with the sales team to know the customer’s current and future expectations (Customer Talk) and work with all departments to resolve customer concerns/issues.
•Lead the sales team to effectively understand and use manufacturers’ products and programs to attain acceptable market share levels.
•Foster an engaged work environment within the location/s, encouraging accountability, open communication, teamwork, and a commitment to serving the customer.
•Ensure that the company/location reputation and image in the community is consistent with RMA/AED Integrated Core Values, and that business relationships with all stakeholders are not compromised.
•Responsible for ensuring that sound and safe business practices and processes are implemented and continuously improved to effectively and efficiently achieve ethical business objectives.
•Perform all other duties as assigned by management in a professional and efficient manner.
Job Requirement:
•A minimum of 4 years of experiences in Sales or related fields 
•Bachelor degree in agriculture or business 
•Have good knowledge in Agriculture and/or Heavy Equipment segments
•Experiences in running Sales Dept or related businesses
•Ability to lead, train, and coach subordinates well
•Be able to travel in nationwide very often
•Cambodian National Only 


How to apply?
Interested candidates are invited to submit your updated curriculum vitae to  recruitment.kh@rmagroup.net or may also contact us on Tel: 092 888 714/ 088 222 8261/ 070 555 494  for inquiring or application. 

RMA CAMBODIA 
No.27, Street 134, P.O. Box 55 Sangkat Mittapheap, khan 7Makara, Phnom Penh 
Website: http://www.cambodia.rmagroup.net
Company Profile:
RMA entered the Cambodian market in 1992 as an exclusive provider of dedicated system solutions for commercial and non-commercial enterprises in the sectors of infrastructure, energy and logistics. Gradually, the company has been growing alongside the development of Cambodia and expanded to automotive, agricultural and heavy equipment, warehouse solutions, financial services, car rental and food franchise management.  In addition to business expansion, RMA Cambodia has also focused its attention on human resources by providing internships and employment opportunities to approximately 2,000 local and professional staff with a number of expatriates working together to share their skills and expertise.

RMA Cambodia has also been very active within local communities. We consistently work with local authorities and organizations to provide financial and technical assistance in essential key sectors, such as health, environment, education and sports.

We aim to help Cambodia grow and prosper.

OUR SERVICES AND PRODUCTS:

RMA Cambodia and its affiliate Asia Vehicle Rental (AVR) are offering franchised car rental services through the global brand AVIS. Rentals are customized with brand-new Ford vehicles and experienced English-speaking chauffeurs. AVIS also offers car rental and leasing that meets all types of customers requirements for business trips, leisure or field work, with or without chauffeurs.

RMA Cambodia has a financing arm, RMA Financial Services, offers financing solutions to flexibly meet the needs of corporate and retail customers for the purchase of their own automotive and heavy equipment, agricultural machinery and warehouse solution equipment.

RMA Cambodia is also a provider of heavy equipment products and solutions in construction, road building and maintenance, and agriculture, namely JCB, Mitsubishi FUSO and John Deere. RMA Cambodia is an agent for the world’s leading brands in these industries.
Contact Info: Contact Information RMA CAMBODIA  017888390 #27, St. 134, SangkatMittapheap, Khan 7 Makara, Phnom Penh https://www.careers-page.com/rma-group-company-limited/job/6695W5 017888390

Company Profile:
1. VISION:
“A leading Cambodian social microfinance institution working to achieve positive and lasting changes in the livelihoods of economically active poor families in a socially responsible manner”

2. MISSION:
“To improve the livelihoods, skills, and self-confidence of poor families in Cambodia by providing responsible microfinance and complementary socio-economic services”

3. CORE VALUES:
■ INTEGRITY: 
Chamroeun provides financial services and socio-economic services to its clients to enhance their well-being. It achieves this ethically and with transparent, fair, and cost effective methods. This manner is also applied to Chamroeun’s other stakeholders.

■ QUALITY OF SERVICES: 
At Chamroeun, we believe that our clients deserve tailored as well as efficient services. We provide these services in a convenient, proactive, and timely manner.

■ TRANSPARENCY: 
At Chamroeun, we provide our clients and other stakeholders with complete and accurate information about the terms and conditions of our products and services. Information is provided in a user-friendly manner to enable them to easily understand those terms and conditions.

■ FAIR PRACTICES: 
At Chamroeun, we ensure that the services we provide to our clients as well as the interactions we have with other stakeholders are not unethical or deceptive. We are committed to building relationships that are based on respect, fair treatments, and courtesy.

■ CONFIDENTIALITY: 
Privacy of our clients and other stakeholders is strictly safeguarded and stored, and such data is only used upon their consents, and they are well informed on specific purposes of data usage.

■ NON-DISCRIMINATION: 
Chamroeun considers its clients and other stakeholders as value assets and take all of efforts to make sure that the institution treats them in appropriate manner.
Contact Info: Contact Information Mrs. Nhong Korane  070 960 666 job@chamroeun.com No.425, St. 271, Sangkat Tour Tom Pong II, Khan Chamkarmon, Phnom Penh, Cambodia 070 960 666

Company Profile:
1. VISION:
“A leading Cambodian social microfinance institution working to achieve positive and lasting changes in the livelihoods of economically active poor families in a socially responsible manner”

2. MISSION:
“To improve the livelihoods, skills, and self-confidence of poor families in Cambodia by providing responsible microfinance and complementary socio-economic services”

3. CORE VALUES:
■ INTEGRITY: 
Chamroeun provides financial services and socio-economic services to its clients to enhance their well-being. It achieves this ethically and with transparent, fair, and cost effective methods. This manner is also applied to Chamroeun’s other stakeholders.

■ QUALITY OF SERVICES: 
At Chamroeun, we believe that our clients deserve tailored as well as efficient services. We provide these services in a convenient, proactive, and timely manner.

■ TRANSPARENCY: 
At Chamroeun, we provide our clients and other stakeholders with complete and accurate information about the terms and conditions of our products and services. Information is provided in a user-friendly manner to enable them to easily understand those terms and conditions.

■ FAIR PRACTICES: 
At Chamroeun, we ensure that the services we provide to our clients as well as the interactions we have with other stakeholders are not unethical or deceptive. We are committed to building relationships that are based on respect, fair treatments, and courtesy.

■ CONFIDENTIALITY: 
Privacy of our clients and other stakeholders is strictly safeguarded and stored, and such data is only used upon their consents, and they are well informed on specific purposes of data usage.

■ NON-DISCRIMINATION: 
Chamroeun considers its clients and other stakeholders as value assets and take all of efforts to make sure that the institution treats them in appropriate manner.
Contact Info: Contact Information Mrs. Nhong Korane  070 960 666 job@chamroeun.com No.425, St. 271, Sangkat Tour Tom Pong II, Khan Chamkarmon, Phnom Penh, Cambodia 070 960 666

Company Profile:
RMA entered the Cambodian market in 1992 as an exclusive provider of dedicated system solutions for commercial and non-commercial enterprises in the sectors of infrastructure, energy and logistics. Gradually, the company has been growing alongside the development of Cambodia and expanded to automotive, agricultural and heavy equipment, warehouse solutions, financial services, car rental and food franchise management.  In addition to business expansion, RMA Cambodia has also focused its attention on human resources by providing internships and employment opportunities to approximately 2,000 local and professional staff with a number of expatriates working together to share their skills and expertise.

RMA Cambodia has also been very active within local communities. We consistently work with local authorities and organizations to provide financial and technical assistance in essential key sectors, such as health, environment, education and sports.

We aim to help Cambodia grow and prosper.

OUR SERVICES AND PRODUCTS:

RMA Cambodia and its affiliate Asia Vehicle Rental (AVR) are offering franchised car rental services through the global brand AVIS. Rentals are customized with brand-new Ford vehicles and experienced English-speaking chauffeurs. AVIS also offers car rental and leasing that meets all types of customers requirements for business trips, leisure or field work, with or without chauffeurs.

RMA Cambodia has a financing arm, RMA Financial Services, offers financing solutions to flexibly meet the needs of corporate and retail customers for the purchase of their own automotive and heavy equipment, agricultural machinery and warehouse solution equipment.

RMA Cambodia is also a provider of heavy equipment products and solutions in construction, road building and maintenance, and agriculture, namely JCB, Mitsubishi FUSO and John Deere. RMA Cambodia is an agent for the world’s leading brands in these industries.
Contact Info: Contact Information Heng Sokchan (Mr.)  070 555 494 / 017 735 688 recruitment.kh@rmagroup.net #27, St. 134, SangkatMittapheap, Khan 7 Makara, Phnom Penh 070 555 494 / 017 735 688

Job Description:
Sales Development & Management: 
-Assist the respective regional head/and CAO of Life Channel to develop and support the branch expansion strategies and plan 
-Liaison with various stakeholders to ensure the timely and successful branch set up   
-Develop the sound branch sale growth strategies and tactical business plan (including recruitment plan) for ensuring the success of the branch sale target under the direct support from the respective Regional Manager and Head of Agency Sales Management. 
-Lead and manage the branch sales and support team to ensure the well execution of the branch sales activity and recruitment plan 
-Closely work with  Pru venture Development Manager (PDM), Business Development Manager (BDM), and agency leader (BM/BD) to ensure better alignment of the branch business plan and sound sale growth activities including recruitment plan 
-Regularly review the branch sale performance and work with the branch team as well as guidance from the regional manager to take prompt and corrective actions for boosting the performance back 
-Conduct the regular branch area market and competition analysis for supporting the branch strategic sales and business growth plan 
-Identify and support key agency leaders to step out into new more potential business territories 

Branch Operation Management: 
-Work closely with cross-functions (i.e. training and development, customer services, sale support operation, NBUW, and property team) to ensure having enough functional support for smoothing the branch business operation with customer centricity 
-Ensure the branch operational efficiency regarding to branch allocated budget, sales materials, branch properties and branch management team productivity 
-As a company ambassador to liaise with local authorities and other business partners for smoothing the branch business and operational activities 
Training and Supervision: 
-Coach and develop the PVM, BDM, and branch support Operation Manager (OM) to make sure they are well equipped with proper skills, right attitude and behavior for delivering their tasks and duties 

Risk and Compliance Management: 
-Manage and control all risk and compliance related to sales and act as first line of defense at the direct team level.  
-Work closely with legal, risk and compliance team at HQ for necessary support and fulfillment.
Job Requirement:
-3-year experience in Financial Services Frontline, Training and development, OR Sales.  
-At least 1 year experience in leading a good team 
-Bachelor’s degree in education/training or business 
-Highly ambitious, independent thinker, disciplinary and high level of empathy 
-Being good at listening skills, teamwork and demonstrates intellectual curiosity. 
-Good problem solving, critical thinking, and motivation/energetic skill 
-Good knowledge of preparing and monitoring the business plan

“ Prudential (Cambodia) Life Assurance PLC provides equal opportunities to all candidates regardless gender, religious, race, age, social origin based on their merit and non-discriminated qualifications. We believe in diversity in our employee population and make sure the employees have proper guidelines for selection and recruitment process. “
Company Profile:
Prudential (Cambodia) Life Assurance PLC began operations in Cambodia in January 2013. It is the leading life insurer in Cambodia with more than USD280 million assured and 27,000 policies issued (as at 31 September 2015). One of the first life insurers in Cambodia, Prudential Cambodia is committed to raising the awareness of life insurance among the Cambodian people and helping them protect and secure their financial futures.

Prudential Cambodia is part of UK-based Prudential plc. Founded in 1848, Prudential plc is an international financial services group with significant operations in Asia, the US and the UK. It serves around 25 million insurance customers and have £505 billion of assets under management (as at 30 June 2015). Prudential plc is listed on the stock exchanges in London, Hong Kong, Singapore and New York.

Prudential plc is not affiliated in any manner with Prudential Financial, Inc., a company whose principal place of business is in the United States of America.
Contact Info: Contact Information PCLA Recruitment HR Manager 087333908 pclarecruitment@prudential.com.kh Phnom Penh Tower, 20F, #445 Monivong Blvd, Boeung Prolit, 7 Makara, Phnom Penh 087333908

Job Description:
Description
The ideal candidate for the Sales Representative position will have experience in all areas of the sales function. 
The position’s responsibilities include oversee and coordinate sales procedure. Establish work priorities, and ensure deadlines and sales targets are met and procedures are followed. Resolve customer complaints regarding sales and service. Monitor customer preferences to determine the focus of sales efforts. Develop plans to acquire new customers or clients, through direct sales techniques, and business to business marketing visits. The Sales Representative reports to the Sales Manager and is responsible for developing and maintaining favorable relationships with current and potential customers, achieving sales goals of our precast concrete products business, developing short and long term sales strategies and sales plans to increase the region's sales volume and profit margins. 
- Key Responsibilities Assist the Area Sales Manager in developing strategy and tactics that ensure the attainment of company sales goals and profitability in key markets through assigned geography. 
- Conduct in-depth analysis to include on demand forecasting, competitor capabilities, customer profiles and the next best alternatives. 
- Develop and maintain relationships within the engineering community. 
- Establish short and long term goals and strategies in regards to key clients and prospects.
Job Requirement:
- Bilingual Chinese/ English preferred work permit will be provided for non-Cambodian nationals. 
- A true desire to satisfy the needs of others in a fast paced environment
- A university degree or college diploma in business, civil engineering, industrial engineering, management, economics or marketing required.
- Experience in construction materials sales is usually required.
- Refined verbal and written communication skills
- 1 or more years of sales representative in construction material industry preferred

Primary Location: CA-Phnom Penh, Cambodia
Organization: Phnom Penh Precast Construction
Pay Basis: Yearly US Dollar (USD)
Job Level: Sales Representative| Full-time
Job: Sales Representative
Equal Employment Opportunity
The company’s policy on equal employment opportunity 
prohibits discrimination based on race, color, religion, national of origin, gender, sexual orientation, and age. This policy is applied to recruiting, hiring, transfers, promotions, terminations, compensations and benefits.
Company Profile:
Our story began 40 years ago when a group of experienced Thai engineers from the United States created the Vong Chai Company Limited (VCON) with the desire to provide durable construction materials in Thailand.  Forty years later VCON became one of Thailand’s largest construction companies. Our main inspiration was to develop and upgrade local construction materials with cutting edge technology.  Through extensive research, our V-CON Hollow-Core Precast Concrete Slabs was developed as an alternative product to the Thai construction market. The Hollow-Core precast concrete is currently the latest technology being used in the United States and we are currently one of the region’s largest Hollow-Core producers. Since the establishment of our company, VCON’s culture has thrived on strong principles, which have been passed by the hands of our managements and workforce from generation to generation. Building strong, long-term relations with our clients is the key to our success as a company.
VCON is a company known for its innovation, hard work and integrity. It is a company that has been around for over 40 years and is currently ranked one of the largest and top construction firms in Thailand. In addition, VCON has consistently ranked one of the top hollow-core suppliers in Thailand. VCON is also a very versatile company obtaining engineers, technicians and operations managers who exhibit expertise to construct a wide Range of buildings, airports, hotels, warehouse, department stores, as well as many other channeling tasks

The VCON culture is built around 40- year tradition of innovation, excellence, and superior customer satisfaction. Explore your career potential and future with us.
Contact Info: Contact Information HR Department  095 508 181 / 096 915 55 66 / 061 286 168 vcon@vconthai.com A5-8 La Seine Diamond Island Tonle Bassac, Chamkarmon, PP,Cambodia 095 508 181 / 096 915 55 66 / 061 286 168

Job Description:

•	Planning and Daily visits new customers\

Job Description:
Customer Relationship Management  
•	Identify key contacts at potential client or partner companies to establish and foster a relationship for collaboration on sales, promotion campaign, discount partnership etc.  
•	Prepare project presentation and participate in one-on-one meetings with clients or partners to present and explain the “Ford Cambodia Club” project in an effort to guide their choices.
•	Understand the problems and challenges of clients or partners and identify ways the business could better address those needs.
•	Prepare & update MOU or Partnership Agreement with Clients or Partners 
•	Maintain good relationships with clients and partner, so that the business can maximize the value of those relationships.
•	Grow the business by identifying new sales and business development opportunities.
•	Seek opportunities to cross-sell or upsell to existing clients.
•	Monitor and assess activities of our competitors to proactively satisfy and retain our clients or partners. 
•	Provide excellent service in order to maintain a positive reputation for the business.
•	Resolve any customer complaints in a prompt and professional manner.
•	Set revenue targets and then develop and execute a strategy to meet those.

Marketing Plan & Event Management
•	Working with creative designer and marketing team to produce or create POSM, Merchandise, and other marketing materials for Ford Cambodia Club Project.
•	Distribute all POSM, Merchandise, and other marketing materials to all outlet of clients and partner companies.  
•	Prepare event proposal, checklist, budget plan from pre-production until finish event
•	Delivering events on time, within budget, that meet or exceed expectations
•	Setting, communicating, and maintaining timelines and priorities on every project
•	Managing supplier relationships
•	Provide leadership, motivation, and direction and support to marketing team
•	Travelling to onsite inspections and project managing events
•	Ensuring quality delivery of every project

Reporting & Team Work
•	Membership & Partners Database Report 
•	Weekly & Monthly Marketing Activities Report
•	Quarterly & Yearly Work Plan 
•	Event Management Checklist & Update
•	Work with team in marketing department and other departments to contribute effective and efficient execution
•	Handling with any other tasks directed by Marketing Manager
Job Requirement:
Requirements and Qualifications
•	Ability to build, foster, and maintain positive professional relationships.
•	Devotion to high-quality customer service.
•	Excellent interpersonal communication skills.
•	Event Management Skills. 
•	Keen analytical and research abilities.
•	Knowledge of negotiation and relationship management best practices.
•	Sound written and verbal communication skills.
•	Problem solving and conflict resolution capabilities.
•	Willingness to develop an in-depth understanding of the business and related services.
•	Bachelor’s degree in business, marketing, management, or related field.
•	3+ years of experience in a sales & marketing or customer service role.
•	Outgoing and customer-oriented attitude.
•	Computer literacy (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Internet, Email, and Social Media etc.)

Please send your CV to:
chansokha.hou@rmagroup.net

Job Description:
Role and Responsibility:
• Collecting data, perform financial due diligence and analysis on prospective projects and recommend an investment decision.
• Working with senior analysts to develop additional quantitative and analytical tools to enhance security selection and portfolio management.
• Supporting in creating financial models that enhance return on investment of projects and financial
• Preparing financial documents for presentation to potential and current investors on specific investments
• Conducting market research on the industry and gather market intelligence to enhance management of funds.
• Maintain up-to-date information on the latest economic trend in the country, latest and any updates in the financial markets.
• Provide general administrative support in areas of quality assurance, quality control and service
• Working independently and within a team on miscellaneous projects as assigned
• Assisting team in identifying capabilities and processes that drive continuous improvement
• Preparing reports provided to investors occasionally or team assigned
• Performing active surveillance of portfolio holdings in order to identify trends and make recommendations
• Identifying and communicating ways to improve underwriting and surveillance practices
• Working closely with senior analysts from the Investment Grade credit research team who are evaluating risk and return profile of fixed income securities
• Other task assigned
Job Requirement:
• Bachelor’s Degree in accounting, finance or related field
• 2 years of working experience in finance, trading or related field
• Strong knowledge in probability theory, statistics, econometrics, and numerical analysis
• Be able to communicate in English and Chinese is a plus
• High level of proficient with Microsoft Office, particularly strong excel and research skills
• Strong commitment, conscientious, result oriented, independence, flexible, and good communication 
• Team player with a high level of professionalism, strong communications skills and ability to fit in a team environment

Company Profile:
Amret (https://www.amret.com.kh) is a leading microfinance institution established in 1991 that contributes to the economic and social development of Cambodia by providing a wide range of financial services to meet the needs of the large targeted customers. Amret has strong commitment and long-term business strategies to be a leading financial institution in the market by deploying ambitious digital strategies. 

Amret belongs to the Advans international group (www.advansgroup.com) a major shareholder and international shareholder (FMO and IFC). The Advans group serves over 750,000 clients, and has expanded its operations in nine countries such as Cambodia, Cameroon, Ivory Coast, Democratic Republic of Congo, Ghana, Myanmar, Nigeria, Pakistan, and Tunisia. 

Amret has more than 150 branches, located in 25 cities and provinces in Cambodia, and successfully serves 450,000 customers with around 4,000 highly dedicated employees.

Company Profile:
Smart Axiata Co., Ltd., Cambodia’s leading mobile telecommunications operator, currently serves 8 million subscribers under the ‘Smart’ brand. Smart Axiata is part of Axiata Group Berhad, one of Asia’s largest telecommunications groups.

Smart is at the forefront of mobile technology advancement in Cambodia. Smart was the first network to introduce 4G LTE in 2014, 4G+ in 2016 and 4G+ with HD Voice (VoLTE) in early 2017. In mid-2017, Smart introduced cutting-edge 4.5G, manifesting its data leadership position in Cambodia. Smart also provides 2G, 2.5G, 3G and 3.75G mobile services as well as international roaming across more than 190 countries. Its extensive nationwide network coverage stretches to more than 98% of the Cambodian population.

The company is also rapidly transforming itself into a digital lifestyle brand, having introduced many innovative offerings and lifestyle entertainment value propositions. This includes various international partnerships, with brands as diverse as Universal Music, Apple, Facebook and iflix, as well as digital services including SmartLuy, Smart Insurance, SmartPay, Smart Music and SmartNas. Smart aspires to become Cambodia’s Digital Champion, while playing an active role in socio-economic growth.

The company’s workforce consists of more than 1000 local and foreign experts. Smart is committed to its customers, employees and the people of Cambodia, in delivering its promise of enriching their lives through world-class networks, exceptional digital experiences and through significant corporate social responsibility engagements.
Contact Info: Contact Information TAN Chouleang HR Manager 010202655 jobs@smart.com.kh No464 A, Monivong Blvd, Sangkat Tonlebasac, Khan Chamkarmoan, Phnom Penh  010202655

Job Description:
** JOB PURPOSE
To assist with the Senior Supervisor, Senior Executive and Assistant Director, Finance & Corporate Services (FCS), Singapore (Cambodia) International Academy Co., Ltd. (SCIA), a Cambodia registered and subsidiary of Singapore Institute of Management International Pte. Ltd. The Officer for Accounts Receivable is responsible for the following areas:

** RESPONSIBILITIES:
- Issue invoice and credit note and ensure all supporting are attached and issued on timely basis
- Issue statement of account/ Reminder letter to students for outstanding payment
- Update the sale listing and ensure that sale listing are verified with invoice issue, supporting documents
- Ensure that collection modes are proper collected.
- Verified banknotes (USD or cheque) is valid and not fake
- Issue receipt and verify of the amount received
- Ensure all official receipts issue have supporting attached.
- Ensure that cash float keep safe
- Daily cash hand over to the Supervisor
- Updates the weekly outstanding balance
- Report over/under between actual collection and collection reports
- Ensure that work area is clean, secure, and well-maintained
- Record invoices into accounting system
- Record credit note into accounting system
- Record receipts into accounting system
Job Requirement:
(a) Academic Education/Training/Experience
- Degree in Finance or Accountancy, or any other internationally recognized professional accounting qualification.
- At least 1-2 years of work experience in accounting or related field
- Proficient in English and computer skills related to accounting

(b) Personal Attributes
- Willing to work flexibly in a dynamic and fast-paced environment
- Excellent interpersonal, communication, people management skills
- Strong ability in teamwork and problem-solving
- Ability to work independently, as well as in collaboration with others
- Work well under pressure, well organised and with strong attention to detail
- Ability to multitask and manage tight deadlines
Company Profile: At SCIA, we are committed to providing a holistic education for lifelong learners. Our K12 school offers the unique blend of Cambridge & Singapore curricula for 2-18 years old. We also offer an exciting range of programmes through our enrichment hub - Play Network. From performing arts to STEM, sports to clubs and societies, we have something to cater to every interest. Recognising the importance of nurturing future leaders in Cambodia, SCIA offers the following programmes to cater to the different needs of learners:- Early Childhood Education- Primary Education- Secondary Education- Pre-University EducationOur Education and Career Guidance (ECG) team will support students in making informed decisions about their future, helping them to transition smoothly from school to further education or participate in our courses and international learning journeys.

Job Description:
To work with the School Leaders and Head of Department, Singapore (Cambodia) International Academy Co., Ltd. (SCIA), a Cambodia registered subsidiary of SIM International Academy Pte. Ltd., the Mathematics Teacher, is responsible for the following areas:

** JOB PURPOSE:
- Conceptualise and plan Science programmes for (but not limited to) Grade 1 to Grade 6 students.
- Teach Science to a range of classes of different levels and language proficiencies.
- Create a conducive environment for effective Teaching & Learning.
- Monitor and evaluate the progress and development of students
- Provide useful and timely feedback to students and parents.
- Assess student learning to facilitate positive academic and effective development.
- Monitor students’ well-being and motivate them to achieve their goals.
- Work with others to support the department in curriculum
development/review and other departmental needs.
- Communicate effectively with all stakeholders.
- Maintain up-to-date subject knowledge and prepare relevant teaching resources.
- Delivering effective Science lessons in accordance with Cambridge and Singapore curriculum standards to students of different proficiencies.
- Ensuring the development of 21st Century skills through the teaching of Science.
- Adopting teaching and learning styles which stimulate student interest and active involvement in learning.
- Designing and implementing effective assessments to monitor academic standards and ensuring that the students’ learning is effective and continuous.
- Coaching students on Science-related projects and competitions
- Reviewing and designing instructional materials based on students’ needs and instructional objectives of the curriculum.
- Developing curricular resources aligned to departmental framework to support students’ learning.
- Contributing to the school-wide STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering and Mathematics) curriculum design and implementation (e.g. oversee Science laboratory and activities)
Job Requirement:
1. Academic Education / Training / Experience
- Degree in Science from a recognised university.
- Strong knowledge in curriculum, pedagogy and assessments.
- Minimum 3 years of working experience in education institutions.
- Experience in teaching in an international setting is an advantage.

2. Personal Attributes 
- Willing to be stationed in Phnom Penh, Cambodia
- Willing to work flexibly in dynamic and fast-paced environment, and to travel extensively (when necessary)
- Excellent interpersonal, communication and presentation skills
- Strong ability in leadership, networking, teamwork, and problem-solving
- Meticulous, analytical and self-driven
- Ability to think strategically
- Ability to work independently, as well as in collaboration with others
- Ability to “think outside the box” in identifying problems and implementing solutions
- Works well under pressure, well organised and with strong attention to details
- Ability to multitask and manage tight deadlines

Job Description:
** JOB DESCRIPTION
To work with the School Leaders and Head of Department, Singapore (Cambodia) International Academy Co., Ltd. (SCIA), a Cambodia registered subsidiary of SIM International Pte. Ltd., The Teacher, Chinese Language is reporting to Head of Department, Chinese and is responsible for:

**​​​​ JOB PURPOSE:
- Instruct students in subject-specific classrooms.
- Create lesson plans; evaluate student performances; and teach using lectures, technology and hands-on learning experiences.
- Model expected behaviours to establish and maintain an orderly, disciplined classroom.
- Creating daily lesson plans and learning activities for students based on Cambridge International standards in Chinese Language education and research and knowledge of developmental behaviours.
- Delivering high-quality, engaging instruction in the form of discussion, direct teaching, demonstrations and independent practice using a variety of proven methods.
- Differentiating lessons when needed to give all students access to the curriculum regardless of disability, instructional level, English proficiency or level of interest in the subject.
- Evaluating student performance on tasks established by the standards using different methods such as observation, performance-based tasks or other standard test practices.
- Maintaining a safe, orderly and supportive classroom by modelling expected behaviours and standards, promoting positive interactions and quickly addressing behaviours that are not in line with the school discipline plan.
- Communicating with parents regarding student progress, potential and behaviours periodically through phone or electronic means and at parent and teacher conferences.
- Improving skills and knowledge in teaching by regularly taking classes, attending workshops and discovering new methods of delivering exciting content to students.
- Performing other functions as necessary or assigned by Supervisors / Heads of Division.
- Assisting Supervisors / Heads of Division in any projects or tasks in relation to company goals and objectives.
- Participating in all School-wide events.
Job Requirement:
1. Academic Education / Training / Experience
- Degree in related Chinese Language majors from an internationally recognised university.
- Teaching certification from a recognised institution.
- Competent in Chinese Language for use in Teaching and Learning, as well as data analysis
- Strong knowledge in curriculum, pedagogy and assessments.
- Experience in teaching in an international setting is an advantage.
- Minimum 3 years of working experience in education institutions.
- Knowledge of Chinese Language using Singapore and/or Cambridge curriculum.
- Experience in teaching in an international setting, as well as managing a department in school, is an advantage.

2. Personal Attributes 
- Strong passion in education with the ability to inspire students
- Willing to be stationed in Phnom Penh, Cambodia
- Willing to work flexibly in dynamic and fast-paced environment
- Excellent interpersonal, communication and presentation skills
- Strong ability in leadership, networking, teamwork, and problem-solving
- Meticulous, analytical and self-driven
- Ability to think strategically
- Ability to work independently, as well as in collaboration with others
- Ability to “think outside the box” in identifying problems and implementing solutions
- Works well under pressure, well organised and with strong attention to details
- Ability to multitask and manage tight deadlines

company_name: TAING CHENG OING CONSTRUCTION & IMPORT EXPORT CO., LTD.
Job Description:
Scope & Role Purpose

Document Controller: is responsible for accurate management and safeguarding of documentation generated by the project team, contractors and suppliers in support of the day‐to‐day operation of the project and in a manner that will enable all relevant parties to quickly retrieve them. This includes, but is not limited to, drawings, method statements, (operating) procedures, manuals, engineering/technical reports, correspondence and project management files.

Duties & Responsibilities 

- Control all aspects of project documentation on multiple simultaneous projects, utilizing various control methods/systems.
- Prepare, operate and update Document Control Procedures in line with the Project Management Department’s Document Control/Management System.
- Ensure proper document control support is given to Projects, Sections and Departments.
- Produce and maintain Document Progress Reports to Projects, Sections and Departments.
- Ensure all documentation provided is as per Project Management Department quality formatting requirements. Formatting may include correcting templates, fonts and style, pagination and numbering and other activities that may be required to achieve Project Management Department’s documentation requirements.
- Create Document Control and correspondence folders for individual Projects, Sections and Departments.
- Work in strict co‐operation with the Projects, Sections and Departments to ensure project progress status integration.
- Ensure all templates used with the Project Management’s Department conform to the Company standard.
- Ad hoc duties as required to assist the Project Management Department.
- Other tasks assigned by Manager.
Job Requirement:
Education / Skills/ Experiences Requried

- University student Bachelor degree any field preferred in Finance and Accounting. 
- Experience customer an advantage.
- A great personality the telephone advantage.
- Language proficiency spoken & written English must.
- Proficient in MS-office
- Language proficiency spoken & written Chinese advantage.
- Computer literate – MS Word, Excel PowerPoint
- Good communications interpersonal skills.
- Ability Know how to deal with customer/ Clients in a positive friendly manner.
- Ability to work under pressure and flexible working hour
- Honest, and with high level of integrity

** Working Days & Hours 
-Monday to Friday	:  8:00am to 12:00pm & 1:00pm to 5:00pm
-Saturday		:  8:00am to 12:00pm
-Luch Break 		:  1 Hour

Reporting line 
- Document Controller works under supervision & reports directly to Project Management Director, Assistant PD and other related assignment management

Salary, Compensation & Benefits 
Salary (Negotiable)
- Lunch
- Proeject KPI Bonus 
- Annual Salary increment
- Annual Staff Party
- Annual Trip

Job Description:
- Working Day : Monday-Friday (8:00AM-500PM)
- Salary : Negotiate
- Type of Contract : A long-term contract will be offered depending on performance with 3-month probation period.
- Benefit : Seniority indemnity, NSFF, Personal Accident Insurance, health care and Other Employee Benefit under the Law of the Royal Government of Cambodia are fully provided

** DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES:
* Accounting Management
- Supervise Accountants and maintain accurate accounting record (records asset, liability, revenue, and expenses entries by compiling and analyzing account information)
- Ensure the proper use and evolutions of the chart of Accounts in accordance with the accounting principles and financial reporting standards
- Manage and balance subsidiary accounts by verifying, allocating, posting, reconciling transactions; resolving discrepancies (ex. Account Receivable, Account Payable…)
- Perform month-end and year-end accounting closing activities such as bank reconciliation, cash reconciliation and journal adjustment entries
- Summarizes financial status by collecting information; preparing balance sheet, profit & loss, and other statements
- Secures financial information by completing database backups
- Projects organization's value by keeping information confidential
- Review and recommend changes to existing accounting procedures if needed
 
* Control, Audit & Reporting
- Control on the operational monthly expenditures regarding the budget allocation
- Completes external audit by analyzing and scheduling general ledger accounts; providing information for auditors
- Internal control by setting up guidelines with the finance manager to certify accuracy to external partners
- Monitor and communicate the performance of the organization (KPI and P&L monitoring)
- Monitor and communicate the global performance of the production sites (operational dashboard) to support the framework
- Ensure on-time reporting to donor (Monthly calendar follow-up, qualitative monitoring of the status with each donors)
Job Requirement:
** QUALIFICATIONS & ELECTION CRITERIA:
* Knowledge
- Five or more years of experience in accounting Good knowledge in accounting software such as
- Experience in audit
- Excellent in Khmer and English both writing and speaking
- Microsoft Office

* Skills
- Good facilitation and liaison skills
- Research skills
- Corporate finance
- Financial software
- General math skills
- Attention to detail and high accuracy, rigor, problem solving skill
- Ability to communicate clearly with the team and management Attitude
- Confidentiality
- Punctual and deadline-oriented
- Be respectful and transparent in dealing with others
- Open minded and willing to learn
- Very active and proactive

Company Profile:
Teuk Saat 1001 is a NGO, established in 2007. Our main mission is to develop water kiosks in the rural communities
to improve the access of safe drinking water in a sustainable manner. The role of Teuk Saat 1001, besides developing station, is to support the entrepreneurs by providing a range of services such as technical support, monthly water quality monitoring and personalized coaching. Today, through a network of 900 entrepreneurs, operating 300 stations, in 18 provinces, O-We (brand of Teuk Saat 1001) is serving, on the daily basis, more than 800,000 beneficiaries, including 350,000 children.

Job Description:
** Job Purpose:

The incumbent will execute the solution area under his/ her and the roadmap for the technology platform or the end solutions supported and acts as the SME for key technology areas. To implement solution according to design philosophies emphasizing on system attributes such as flexibility and modularity. 

** Key Responsibilities:
- Provide customer support and assistance in issue troubleshooting and resolution.
- Provide support and maintenance to existing Channel Applications.
- Responsible for planning, organizing, and directing the activities of development of channel applications
- Participate in cross-functional meetings to resolve customer issues.
- Ensure that the team follows best practices, compliance to IT standards, SDLC standards, policies and procedures.
- Ensure standard operating procedure, document guideline are up to date based on current practices
- Update line manager about project status, updates and concerns on daily basis.
- Ensure all project-related documents are properly updated and maintained.
- Identify risks and develop mitigation plans.
- Drive the stakeholders for completion of documentation relating to business requirement and system designing specifications with required verification's sign-off
- To execute 2nd level production and incident support through close interaction with other level
- Perform other responsibilities and duties periodically assigned by the reporting authority in order to achieve the overall functional objectives of the division
Job Requirement:
- A bachelor’s degree in information technology or related discipline
- 4+ years of IT related experience in the related field, preferably in financial industry
- A demonstrated record of accomplishment of making a difference and adding value. Must be able to develop relationships across IT and business units, working cross functionally to achieve results
- Proven ability to lead and demonstrate strong sense of ownership
- Proven ability to present complex information in a simplified fashion to facilitate understanding
- Experience in executive communication
- Good understanding about System Development Life Cycle and DevOps
- Knowledge of coding languages Xamarin (preferred), C#, .NET, .NET Core, ASP.NET, TSQL, PLSQL, DB2, JavaScript) and frameworks/systems (e.g. Entity Framework, Ajax, Repository)
- Experience in Fiorano, Mobile, AS400, Web and API
Self-motivated, action-and-result oriented, team player and proven ability to influence others
- Excellence verbal / written communication, presentation and interpersonal skills
- Good analytical, technical, written and communication skill
- Ability to work in the team

Job Description:
FaceLine Cambodia is specialized in providing the best results to satisfy your beauty and aesthetics need in ways that avoid harsh and potentially harmful effects of plastic surgery using non-invasive techniques.

Our goal is to help solve skin problems, avoid wrinkles, delay aging, fight acne, increase skin vitality, revitalize dull aged skin, erase blemishes, accelerate your natural skin regeneration, to give you that firm, soft and younger looking skin, as safe and as painless as possible.
Faceline is a beauty and aesthetic skin care clinic that would make you Look Younger Without Plastic Surgery. 
We are currently looking for qualified candidate to fulfil the position of Clinic Technician ( Faceline Clinic)
Job Requirement:
Job responsibilities:

• Provide a selection of services to the customer with the ability to use the machines
       - Acne extraction
       - Hair removal
       - Facial massages 
       - Body massages
• Prepare all service rooms every morning
• Count stock every week/month
• Prepare order list when stock count is low
• Assist  doctors when required 
• Train/transfer practical knowledge and skills to new members in the clinic
• Keep clear records of the patient’s machine settings in their files
• Focus and pay attention to the customer’s problem area in order to achieve maximum results
• Clean and sterilize use in clinic equipment.

Job Requirement:

• Can read and understand English. Vietnamese language is a plus
• At least High School Diploma
• Some experience in aesthetic clinics
• Bright and positive personality
• Friendly and welcome to customers
• Some experience in massage is a plus

Job Description:
2. POSITION PURPOSE

Support and work with the team on developing and implementing IT software solution, in contribution to fulfill business objectives.

3. PRINCIPAL ACCOUNTABILITIES
Senior mobile engineer is responsible for:
• Develop Mobile and Web Application
• Analyze the business specs / technical specs of the assigned projects to develop the systems which meet requirement and timing.

• University Graduate, major in Information Technology.

• IT technical analysis and programming: at least 5 years
• Highly experienced mobile development languages Swift, Kotlin/Java

• Highly experience DBMS such as SQL/Oracle and DB2 is advantage
• Highly experience front-end web technologies such CSS, XML, HTML, Bootstrap, and Angular
• Experience API technologies
• Experience with Agile software development and software development life cycle (SDLC)
• Expertise in developing software architecture and OOP concept.

** Skills:
• Flexible and fast learner
• Good analytical skills and problem solving
• Strong commitment
• Able to work under pressure and multitasking
• Good team player, independent and result-oriented
• Excellent interpersonal and communication skills
• Good command of spoken and written English

Job Description:
2. JOB PURPOSE
Reporting to an assigned Team Leader, the Business Analyst is responsible for contributing to meeting user commitments according to plan.

3. PRINCIPAL ACCOUNTABILITIES
The Business Analyst is responsible for:
- Assisting user in defining business requirements to meet their business goals
- Preparing business specification documents
- Participates and contributes during studies and/or gap analysis to identify functional gaps between the user’s
current processes and current company systems’ functionality.
- Analyzes data to determine solutions to system processing according to the user’s business requirements.
- Conducting System tests (ST), support User Acceptance tests (UAT)
- Carrying our day-to-day applications and IT operations support
- Implementing and Managing major activities: Product Setup, Product Backlog (Enhancement), Production Issue
- Data Analysis, Statistics
- Project Implementation and Management
Job Requirement:
4. JOB SPECIFICATION
** Education, no. of year experience:
- A university degree/college diploma in Business/Computing, or equivalent business experience
- Experiences in life insurance/financial business is highly preferable.

** Technical skills:
- Basic knowledge of database: MSSQL or MySQL or DB2/XML
- Computer literate in office suite of products (word, spreadsheet, flowchart, presentation etc.)
- Demonstrates basic knowledge of Data Architecture of system and SQL.
- Understanding of applications interfaces between life system and other corporate systems
- Data Analysis/Statistics
- UML Diagram/ SDLC framework

** Soft skills:
- Customer service mindset
- Good analytical skills and attentive to details
- Analytical thinking and a fast learner
- Able to work under pressure and multitasking
- Excellent interpersonal and communication skills
- Good command of spoken and written English

** Personal attributes:
- Good team player, independent and result-oriented
- Flexible and open to changes

job title: Assistant to the Managing Director (Head of Data Science Academy
position: Assistant to the Managing Director (Head of Data Science Academy
Job Description:
*** ABOUT THE JOB POSITION
As our organisation continues to see rapid expansion we are now looking to hire an assistant to the managing director to join our team. Your role will see you engaging with and assisting DataU management team, our cohorts and liaising with all team members across MBD and DOM when necessary. You will focus on supporting the team and look out for process automation opportunities.

You should be able to think creatively, be proactive, have excellent communication and interpersonal skills, be fluent in both English and Khmer (written and conversational) and be an effective problem solver. Experience as an admin or support officer/  equivalent Customer Service experience in a similar role is strongly desired.

** Responsibilities:
● Assist DataU management team with day to day activities such as sending emails, telephone, connect on social media with various partners and key stakeholders
● Support with answering current cohort’s questions
● Liaise with various team members across DataU, MDB, DOM to ensure effective communication across departments
● Liaise with operations team to ensure effective collaboration
● Collaborate with management to develop and implement effective processes and automate them
● At times, you might be require to write, edit, and distribute content, including publications, press releases, website content, and other marketing material that communicates the organization's activities, products and/or services
● You might be required to screen CV, book interviews and ensure effective communication
● Establish and maintain effective relationships with key stakeholders which includes: management team, alumni network, current and prospective trainees and their families
● Seek opportunities to enhance the reputation of the brand, and coordinate publicity events as required.
● Maintain records of correspondences and key communication activities
● Manage conflict as it arises and escalate to management.
● Photocopy and print out documents on behalf of other colleagues
Job Requirement:
** Requirements
● Proven admin or assistant experience
● Knowledge of office management systems and procedures
● Excellent English speaking and writing skills (desirable: Khmer speaking skills)
● Excellent time management skills and ability to multitask and prioritize work
● Ability to juggle multiple projects simultaneously and work in a fast paced environment
● Attention to detail and problem solving skills
● Excellent written and verbal communication skills
● Strong organizational and planning skills
● Proficient IT skills
● Understand email best practices and familiar with main social media channels including Facebook, Instagram, LinkedIn, etc.
● Adaptability and flexibility
● Strong communicator who works well independently and within a team
● Proactive problem solver who seeks to mitigate risks and addresses challenges before they develop into problems
● Understands our organisational culture and communicates in a way that reflects who we are at core
● Must be resourceful and take initiative even when given minimal direction

** Benefits
- Competitive salary
- 28 days leave (inclusive of Cambodian national holidays)
- Professional development fund
- Staff sports/books fund
- Team social calendar
- Flat, respectful and supportive management structure (Ubuntu philosophy)
Company Profile: DataU Academy is part of the award winning Mekong Big Data family, a Phnom Penh based Data Science consultancy, built and scaled by a diverse, inclusive team of local and international experts. At DataU Academy, we recruit, train and deploy local Khmer into high paying, highly skilled data roles, both locally and internationally. This transformative programme sets applicants up for career and personal growth opportunities that otherwise may not have been available to them. By redefining Data Skills training for both developing and developed nations, our mission is to affect change, create new, multi-generational opportunities and reimagine the growth of a nation. At DataU Academy, we’re proud to create tomorrow’s Data Leaders, today.
Contact Info: Contact Information HR HR Manager  hr@mekongbigdata.com Phnom Penh

Job Description:
•	Work with the design team to fully understand the shop drawings and production drawings
•	Ensure that all the MEP confirmed drawings are accompanied with detailed list of MEP material specifications, for instance, functional design, sizes and shapes
•	Ensure that the MEP engineers responsible for building know the MEP drawing that assigned to them with absolute clarity with all the details and particularity and peculiarity accounted for
•	Assist site MEP engineers and MEP foremen with technical advice and administrative support
•	Ensure strict and correct translation of MEP drawings into construction on site
•	Work in close collaboration with MEP foremen to ensure the correct installation of re-bars and form work in strict compliance with the MEP Material installation methods
•	Organize and conduct project meetings for critical MEP activities
•	Assist the MEP engineers in their coordination and relation with the subcontractors and vendors
•	Collaborate with the procurement team for periodical review and update of the material order plan to ensure effective purchase order of MEP material
•	Intervene when there are conflicts between MEP engineers and subcontractors or vendors
•	Coordinate vendors’ work to ensure smooth site work progress and ensure that no one team’s work is held up by other teams
•	Supervise the sub-contractors’ and venders’ work to ensure order and safety at the construction site
•	Maintain staff’s performance by counseling and disciplining via planning, monitoring, and appraising job results
•	Advise/steer the company toward new construction technology
•	Advise the company on key construction personnel selection
•	Advise the procurement team of potential MEP material suppliers
Job Requirement: •	BA in Electrical/Mechanical Engineering or a related field•	At least 5 years of working experience managing big construction projects and/or high-rise buildings•	Knowledge of MVAC, Plumbing, LV, MV, ELV and firefighting system in building •	Strong presentation, written communication, and report-writing skills in English and Khmer•	Good knowledge of Cambodian building code•	Knowledge of MEP Design and drawing•	Strong analytical skills•	Strong sense of urgency and accuracy•	Attention to details

position: ជាងកញ្ចក់ (ប្រាក់ខែចាប់ពី250ដុល្លាឡើងទៅ)
Job Description:
1.លក្ខខណ្ឌជាងកញ្ចក់ (ប្រាក់ខែចាប់ពី250ដុល្លាឡើងទៅ)
- ចេះកាត់ និង តំឡើងញ៉ូមស៊ុមកញ្ចក់
- ចេះកាត់ និង បំពាក់កញ្ចក់
- អ្នកចេះតិចតួច ក៏អាចមកសាកល្បងការងារបានផងដែរ។

2.ឯកសារសម្រាប់ដាក់ពាក្យចូលបំរើការងារ

- អត្តសញ្ញាណប័ណ្ណសញ្ជាតិខ្មែរ

- ប្រវត្តិរូបសង្ខេប

Job Description:
1. Scope of working:

Site Engineer is reporting directly to site manager/Construction Management Director and supervision day to day operation of site work. 

2. Duties & Responsibilities:

- Follow up with site engineer of contractor and/or sub-contractor to ensure that work is being carried out as per design/specification/or planning
- Interact with project manager for clarification in architectural, conducting regular job site inspections, assist in the quality and safety audit
- Identify and highlight possible risk on project
- Accurately inventorying construction material 
- Finishing work
- Coordination for verification of extra claims raise by direct manager;
- Other tasks assigned by manager.
Job Requirement:
3. Qualification & Requirement:

- Degree in Civil Engineering and other equivalent degree;
- Fresh graduated or 2 year of work experience in similar position; 
- Be able to manage workers at the assign site;
- Strong construction knowledge and ability to control the quality and cost;
- Good oral and written English and Khmer communication skills;
- Good negotiation skills, interpersonal skills, and problem solving skills;
- Be friendly, flexible, honestly, hard-working, and be able to work under the pressure.

4. Working Days and Hours:

- Monday to Saturday: 	7:00am to 11:00am & 1:00pm to 5:00pm
- Lunch time: 		11:00am to 1:00pm

- Site Finishing Engineer is based in Site/Branch of Borey Peng Huoth, the department of construction.

6. Relationship:

- Site Finishing Engineer works under supervision & report directly to Site Manager.

- Salary (Negotiable)
- Up to 300% annual incentive
- Annual Salary increment

Job Description:
1. Scope of working

Document Controller: is responsible for accurate management and safeguarding of documentation generated by the project team, contractors and suppliers in support of the day‐to‐day operation of the project and in a manner that will enable all relevant parties to quickly retrieve them. This includes, but is not limited to, drawings, method statements, (operating) procedures, manuals, engineering/technical reports, correspondence and project management files.

2.Duties & responsibilities:

- Control all aspects of project documentation on multiple simultaneous projects, utilizing various control methods/systems.
- Prepare, operate and update Document Control Procedures in line with the Project Management Department’s Document Control/Management System.
- Ensure proper document control support is given to Projects, Sections and Departments.
- Create Document Control and correspondence folders for individual Projects, Sections and Departments.
- Work in strict co‐operation with the Projects, Sections and Departments to ensure project progress status integration.
- Ensure all templates used with the Project Management’s Department conform to the Company standard.
- Other tasks assigned by Manager.
Job Requirement:
3. Qualification & Requirement

- Bachelor degree in Management, Business administration or other relevant field;
- Experience in document management 
- Basic understanding of Engineering / Procurement / Construction
- Able to work in a fast‐paced and deadline‐driven environment;
- Detail‐oriented, dependable and trustworthy;
- Excellent MS Software knowledge;
- Familiar with e‐Document management systems 
- Be a problem solver, able to work under pressure with high responsibility.

4. Working Days and Hours

-Monday to Saturday: 8:00am to 12:00pm & 1:00pm to 5:00pm
- Lunch Time: 12:00pm to 1:00pm

5. Working place

-  Document Controller: is based in Head Office, Department of Project Management.

6. Relationship

- Document Controller works under supervision & reports directly to Project Management Director.

7. Salary and Benefit

- Salary (Negotiable)
- Up to 300% annual incentive
- Annual Salary increment
- Annual Staff Party
- Annual Trip

The HEINEKEN Company, the world's most international brewer who was formerly known as Cambodia Brewery Limited (CBL). The company was established in Cambodia in 1994 as a joint-venture between Asia Pacific Brewery Limited and Progress Import-Export Company, before becoming 100% HEINEKEN in 2014. 

A career with HEINEKEN offers great challenges combined with exciting opportunities to own and grow your career in line with your aspirations.

HEINEKEN has over 85,000 internationally diverse, dynamic, committed and entrepreneurial employees working in over 70 countries on over 300 brands.

HEINEKEN Cambodia offers several exciting packages including:
- Company Transportation (30 mins from PP)

- Personal Development Plan and more.

Job Description:
Job Purpose
To support Accounting & Reporting  Team, driving the agenda of the team and the Accounting & Reporting team along with other key priorities in order to accomplish effective transitions, maintain high standards of service & processes and deliver on-going continuous improvements, in line with our company expectations and business strategy.   

Sales collection, sales order and sales invoice	
- Check daily DIS sales order and invoice issued by Agents. 
- Check daily sales collection against sales invoice and key receipt into BASE JDE.
- Knock off receipts, debit/credit notes Vs invoices in BASE JDE after run sales update.	

Non-Trade sales collection and invoice
- Issue sales non-trade invoice from BASE JDE to customers (i.e. Sales of scrap/miscellaneous item, spent grain, fixed asset disposal).
- Check sales non-trade collection and key receipt into BASE JDE.
- Knock off receipts Vs non-trade invoices in BASE JDE after run sales update.	

Credit/Debit note	
- Issue credit/debit note to Agents (i.e. Credit note pays for Agent claims; Debit note charges for DIS licenses).
- Check credit/debit note amount based on approval list before releasing to Agents.

Accounts Closing & Reporting 	
- Sales update and post all invoices, debit/credit notes, and receipts into accounting system. 
- Verify account receivable ageing report. 
- Follow up and clear long outstanding sales credit invoice (including consignment invoice).
- Prepare daily sales out reconciliaiton.
- Prepare sales non-trade and collection reports.
- Prepare accrual expenses related to OTC stream.
- Prepare account reconciliation for prepayment from Agents, and account related to OTC stream (i.e. Revenue, transportation...).  	
- Close month end activities by deadline. 

Operation Process & Compliance 
 - Support leaders/managers to ensure that there is no pending issue in BWise system for ICFR testing under OTC stream.
 - Work effectively from day-to-day operations with continuous improvement and innovation mindset
Job Requirement:
- Ability to add value in standardization and continuous improvement jobs/programmes 
- Excellent interpersonal skills with the ability to quickly form working relationships, gain credibility and influence solutions in team.
- Proactive in identifying and solving problems/issues 
- A drive for continuous professional development in self and others

Company Profile: AIA Cambodia is guided by our Purpose to help Cambodians live Healthier, Longer, Better lives. Since commencing business in 2017, we’ve become the first life insurer to provide coverage on 26 critical illnesses. As among the Kingdom’s leading insurers, AIA Cambodia today offers market-leading life solutions for all walks of life ranging from tailor-made crucial coverage plans that include critical illnesses, accidents, hospital allowances and overseas emergency assistance.AIA Cambodia has strived to make a significant, positive impact for our customers and communities. As we look to the future, this commitment is reinforced by our Purpose: to help millions of people live Healthier, Longer, Better Lives. Our Purpose guides the decisions we make and the actions we take as an organization — empowering and enabling people to understand and manage their health, while meeting their long-term savings and protection needs. Helping create a healthier Asia is one of the most important and valuable things we can do for our communities, today and tomorrow.AIA Cambodia is the only Cambodian life insurer awarded HR Asia’s “Best Companies to Work for in Asia” for three consecutive years, in 2020, 2021 and 2022. Headquartered in Phnom Penh, the company currently has branches in Siem Reap, Kampot, Kampong Cham and Battambang.
Contact Info: Contact Information HR Department   070 949 111 kh.careers@aia.com  12th Floor, Exchange Square, Street 106-61  ,Sangkat Wat Phnom, Khan Daun Penh, Phnom Penh, Cambodia 070 949 111

Job Description: Objective: To drive the end-to-end delivery of the AIA TDA (Technology, Digital and Analysis) and its related IT project(s) on time, within budget and to support deriving the expected project KPIs. This role is responsible for defining, tracking and communicating in a consistent and effective manner and incorporating effective change, resourcing and risk management controls at project level. Job Responsibility: 1. Manage the assigned IT related project(s) as per AIA Standards and within given budget and timelines, including:• Define project scope, goal, deliverables and identify resource that support business goals in collaboration with senior management and stakeholders.• Develop full-scale project plans and associated communications documents with identified project dependencies and critical path.• Closely track project milestones and deliverables and document the identified risk and issues until closure.• Develop and deliver progress reports, proposals, requirements documentation, presentations and its timely reporting.• Proactively manage changes in project scope, identify potential crises, and devise contingency and mitigation plans.• Effectively communicate project expectations to team members and stakeholders in a timely and clear manner.• Coach, mentor, motivate and supervise project team members and contractors, and influence them to take positive action and accountability for their assigned work.• Manage project budget according to established accounting policies and procedures; forecast project cash flow and report actual cash flow and variance to senior management on a regular basis• Ensure that project activities operate within the policies and procedures of the organization• Conduct project post implementation reviews and submit appropriate recommendations in order to identify project overview, assessment of the predefined KPI achievements and the key lessons learnt. • Keep and archive project documents for audit and future reference purposes.2. Cultivate and support an ethical culture to fulfill legal and compliance requirements and encourage professionalism amongst stakeholders.3. Perform other related project management responsibilities and duties periodically assigned by the reporting line management in order to meet operational and corporate objectives.

Company Profile: AIA Cambodia is guided by our Purpose to help Cambodians live Healthier, Longer, Better lives. Since commencing business in 2017, we’ve become the first life insurer to provide coverage on 26 critical illnesses. As among the Kingdom’s leading insurers, AIA Cambodia today offers market-leading life solutions for all walks of life ranging from tailor-made crucial coverage plans that include critical illnesses, accidents, hospital allowances and overseas emergency assistance.AIA Cambodia has strived to make a significant, positive impact for our customers and communities. As we look to the future, this commitment is reinforced by our Purpose: to help millions of people live Healthier, Longer, Better Lives. Our Purpose guides the decisions we make and the actions we take as an organization — empowering and enabling people to understand and manage their health, while meeting their long-term savings and protection needs. Helping create a healthier Asia is one of the most important and valuable things we can do for our communities, today and tomorrow.AIA Cambodia is the only Cambodian life insurer awarded HR Asia’s “Best Companies to Work for in Asia” for three consecutive years, in 2020, 2021 and 2022. Job Description: Objective: The position is required to perform the critical Data Governance role for AIA Cambodia. The role is set up in alignment with the requirements from Group’s Data Governance StandardsJob Responsibilities:• Drive initiatives in defining, documenting and maintaining data management policies, standards and procedures in alignment to the AIA Data Governance Standards.• Drive the development, documentation, and updating of technology and business processes pertaining to data governance across business functions.• Work in collaboration with Local Data Council, Business Divisions and IT to enforce data management policies for addition, removal, modification, and use of company data.• Perform the main coordinating and communication function of the local data council. • Identify sensitive personal or proprietary data (PII / PSI etc) that requires protection and establish and execute appropriate policies• Understand and map out flow of data internally & externally• Establish and maintain a data dictionary• Help build processes to maintain clean and consistent data across the organization• Collaborate with the Software Development teams to identify potential issues related to data usage during development efforts.• Participate and represent Data Management team in the Local Data Council to discuss and act on data usage, consistency, and issues.• Collaborate with Compliance team on capturing and implementing regulatory requirements for relevant to data management• Prepare Data Profiling / Data Quality report to monitor data quality KPIs for Local Data Council• Lead the follow-up actions related to data challenges and remediation resulted in the Local Data Council meetings•  Ability to maintain, execute and constantly improve the data governance standard of AIA Cambodia•  Ability to deliver to data quality goals defined in Local Data Council•  Effectiveness in stakeholder management•  Effectiveness in team management
Job Requirement: Education• Bachelor / Master’s degree level education from a recognized University preferably in Information Technology, Business Administration and/or Insurance Studies etc• Certified Professional level certification in Data Architecture, Data Analysis etc is a definite advantage.Work Experience• Minimum of three (02) years of work experience having demonstrated the application of Data Governance / Management experience in a similar functional role and in an enterprise level working environment.• Having lead and provided policies, industry best practices guidance and supervision relating the Data Governance to relevant teams from Business and Technology.• Having managed cross functional multiple projects in parallel at project portfolio basis.• Ability to work cross border and multinational working groups.• Experienced in executing regulatory requirements for data privacy protection from PDPA, GDPR or any other international standard acts is an advantage.Knowledge and Skills• Excellent skills in Business user engagement and stakeholder management• Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.• Domain proficiency in insurance business and its operations including distribution channels would be an advantage.• Experienced in Informatica or any ETL and DQ tools would be added advantage.• Able to work independently and highly self-motivated.• Able to work with peers and other stakeholders, a team player.

Company Profile:
Wing Bank (Cambodia) Plc – the bank for every Cambodian – is driven by the vision to provide every Cambodian with convenient access to financial services relevant to, and for the improvement of their daily lives.

Wing Bank has revolutionized the way Cambodians access financial services by introducing instant, secure, and convenient Mobile Financial Services since 18 August 2008.

Today, Wing Bank serves the entire Cambodian population with 100% coverage of the districts in Cambodia thanks to the innovative Wing Bank App, over 10,000 Wing Cash Xpress agents, over 55,000 merchants, and partnerships with industry giants such as Mastercard, MoneyGram, AliPay, WeChat Pay, Western Union, Visa, and Ria.

Wing Bank provides an array of advanced financial products both for individual and corporate customers. These include loans, deposits, micro savings, credit referral services, money transfers, utility and insurance payments, supply chain payments, payroll services and even phone top-ups. In addition, Wing offers retail payments via “WingPay”, and has also introduced the “WingMall” e-commerce platform.

Both small and large companies alike are now using Wing’s payroll and disbursement services, speeding up their payments. Over 80% of Wing’s agents and 50% of customers are women, making Wing a shining example of gender inclusion in the region.

Wing Bank is committed to providing financial, gender and digital inclusion to the unbanked and the under-banked, allowing every Cambodian to enjoy convenience and security when it comes to financial services
Contact Info: Contact Information HR Department   078 988 290 / 078 989 509 / 078 989 114 jobs@wingbank.com.kh No. 721, Preah Monivong Blvd., Sangkat Beung Keng Kang 3, Khan Chamkar Mon, Phnom Penh, Cambodia 078 988 290 / 078 989 509 / 078 989 114

Company Profile:
RMA entered the Cambodian market in 1992 as an exclusive provider of dedicated system solutions for commercial and non-commercial enterprises in the sectors of infrastructure, energy and logistics. Gradually, the company has been growing alongside the development of Cambodia and expanded to automotive, agricultural and heavy equipment, warehouse solutions, financial services, car rental and food franchise management.  In addition to business expansion, RMA Cambodia has also focused its attention on human resources by providing internships and employment opportunities to approximately 2,000 local and professional staff with a number of expatriates working together to share their skills and expertise.

RMA Cambodia has also been very active within local communities. We consistently work with local authorities and organizations to provide financial and technical assistance in essential key sectors, such as health, environment, education and sports.

We aim to help Cambodia grow and prosper.

OUR SERVICES AND PRODUCTS:

RMA Cambodia and its affiliate Asia Vehicle Rental (AVR) are offering franchised car rental services through the global brand AVIS. Rentals are customized with brand-new Ford vehicles and experienced English-speaking chauffeurs. AVIS also offers car rental and leasing that meets all types of customers requirements for business trips, leisure or field work, with or without chauffeurs.

RMA Cambodia has a financing arm, RMA Financial Services, offers financing solutions to flexibly meet the needs of corporate and retail customers for the purchase of their own automotive and heavy equipment, agricultural machinery and warehouse solution equipment.

RMA Cambodia is also a provider of heavy equipment products and solutions in construction, road building and maintenance, and agriculture, namely JCB, Mitsubishi FUSO and John Deere. RMA Cambodia is an agent for the world’s leading brands in these industries.
